Who is Who?

Read the information on the back of each suspect card and Ginger’s interview.

Look for pieces of information that tie each suspect to the descriptions Ginger gives.

Pay special attention to each suspect's favorite memory, favorite teacher, and bequeath. These will help you figure out who Ginger is talking about. Once you knowwho is who, place the tokens on the school map in the locations Ginger mentions.

Marshall Bradshaw (Captain of the Football Team), Carrie Ann Conroy (Class Clown),Harold Park (Cheerleader),Wilma Datlow (Valedictorian),Burton Fitz (Drum Major),Elmer James (Mascot),Minnie Franks (Student Body Prez),Heather Hilton (President of theA/V club)

GPAs

Use Wilma’s GPA as a starting point to calculate the rest of the suspects’ GPAs.

Marshall Bradshaw 1.5, Carrie Ann Conroy 3.0, Harold Park 3.6, Wilma Datlow 4.2, Burton Fitz 3.0,Elmer James 3.6,Minnie Franks 4.0,Heather Hilton 3.2

DJ’s Case

Listen to the audio file from the boom box.

Follow the directions that are given on the back of the DJ’s case card.

1999

“Thank you for listening to the 80s Rewind Hour with Sonya on 99.9 The Fury! You just heard tracks from Huey Lewis and the News and Survivor. I have Def Leppard and Tina Turner headed your way in a few moments. But right now, here’s a track from the incredible Stevie Wonder to keep your day going.”

Puzzle on the Back of the Skating Poster

You will need to have opened the DJ’s case. Listen to the audio from the boom box.

The radio announcer mentions five different artists in the audio clip. Find the artists and their songs on the list found inside the DJ’s case. Match up the song titles to the symbols on the back of the skating poster.

Each song will match with two of the symbols. Pull the letters from the symbols you use and place them together. The order comes from the audio file. But you will need to listen closely. Use the order of the artists as they were played on the radio. Hint: this is not the order they are mentioned in. . This message will help you eliminate a suspect. The message will start with “I know…”

“I know your secret. Good grades, bad person.”

Message on the Back of the Coupon

The hint to translate this puzzle has to do with the mention of Jake. Find where else he is mentioned in the box. Read Burton’s favorite memory.

The part about him skipping two grades is the hint. Write out the alphabet and skip forward two places for the letters in the coded message on the back of the coupon.

The first letter is F. Two spaces from F is H. So H is the first letter. The message will start with, “Hey…”

“Hey Minnie, meet us at Ernies.”

Who Left and Where did they Go?

You will need to solve the puzzle on the back of the coupon card. The information you get from this unlock will help you eliminate a suspect.

franksernies

Library Card/Video Rental Card

Use the movie rental card with the library card.

The number under the barcode on the video rental card and the ID number on the library card have the same number of characters. Some of the numbers are marked out on the rental card. If you mark out the characters that are in the same place on the library card you will get a location.

Example the second number on the rental card is marked out, so mark out the second character in the ID on the library card, which is E. Once you have marked out the character you are supposed to mark out, read what is left. This will give you the location for the first piece of evidence.

Locker 14

Where is the First Piece of Evidence? Unlock

You will need to have eliminated two suspects and know the location of the first evidence to unlock. The information from this unlock will help you eliminate a suspect.

bflocker14

Survey Box Unlock

Follow the directions on the back of the survey card.

A rubik cube has 6 sides with 9 squares on each side. A cassette tape has two spools.

The class motto is on the button. Once the survey box is unlocked you will get two pieces of useful information.

112

Marshall Bradshaw Interview Unlock

You will need to have unlocked the survey box first. Once the survey box is unlocked find out what Wilma’s favorite movie is.

jaws

Message on the Back of the Reunion Poster

You will need to have unlocked Marshall’s information to solve this. In the information Marshall provides, he mentions that Winslow Snyder had a way to pass notes to his friends.

Marshall mentions that it had something to do with taking the fourth. Take every fourth letter on the back of the poster and read the message you get.

This will give the location of the second piece of evidence. The message should start with, “Look in…”

Look in the library, it is on the back shelf.

Arcade Game Parallel Dimensions

Follow the directions on the back of the Parallel Dimensions paper and play the game.

Your character moves along the path, enters a room, your weapon will be changed based on the color of the room, and then you fight the monster. Hint: if you are having trouble getting started, the first correct choice is room 2.

The information you get from this will help you eliminate a suspect. Use the room numbers in order to unlock.

25710

Where is the Second Piece of Evidence? Unlock

You will need to have eliminated two more suspects and know the location of the second piece of evidence to unlock this card. The information from this unlock will help you eliminate a suspect.

dhshelf

Do You Remember the 80s?

Complete the sayings and catchphrases.

Next, pull the indicated letters from the part of the phrase you filled in. If you are having trouble completing any of the phrases, look through the pamphlet and the backs of the suspect cards.

The message will start with “simon…”

simonsaysred

Underside of Desk

You have three shapes that match shapes on the underside of the desk.

Use the three stickers to cover their matching shapes. (Do not use the Blast from the Past sticker) Read what is left uncovered,you should get two words.

This message will go with what you got from the “Do you remember the 80s?” puzzle.

blue red

Photo Booth Unlock

You will need to solve the “Do you remember the 80s?” puzzle and the underside of the desk puzzle to unlock the photo booth.

redbluered

Trophy Case Unlock

Read the back of the suspect cards to know what year Valley Falls High School won the state championship.

This information can be found in both Marshall and Harold’s favorite memories.

If they are the class of 86 (meaning they graduated in the Spring of 1986) what year was it during football season(the fall) in their junior year?

1984

Heather Hilton’s Interview Unlock

You will need to have the trophy case unlocked first. Use the name you found on the back of the plaque in the trophy case.

colt

Location Puzzle

You will need to know who is who first.

Use Ginger’s interview as the starting point. (Place round tokens on school map). Next use Minnie’s info from her interview to find everyone's next locations.

Now use Wilma’s info from her interview to find everyone's new locations. Finally, use Heather’s info from her unlock to find out where one person was during the time of the murder. This will eliminate a suspect.

Starting locations based on Ginger’s interview:
Marshall Bradshaw (Captain of the Football Team) - Parking
Carrie Ann Conroy (Class Clown) - Cafeteria
Harold Park (Cheerleader) - Cafeteria
Wilma Datlow (Valedictorian) - Library
Burton Fitz (Drum Major) - Band Hall
Elmer James (Mascot) - Science Lab
Minnie Franks (Student Body Prez) - Cafeteria
Heather Hilton (President of A/V club) - Gym
New locations based on Minnie’s interview:
Marshall Bradshaw (Captain of the Football Team) - Library
Carrie Ann Conroy (Class Clown) - Bathroom
Harold Park (Cheerleader) - Cafeteria
Wilma Datlow (Valedictorian) - Library
Burton Fitz (Drum Major) - Gym
Elmer James (Mascot) - Math Room
Minnie Franks (Student Body Prez) - Gone
Heather Hilton (President of A/V club) -Teachers’ Lounge

New locations based on Wilma’s interview:
Marshall Bradshaw (Captain of the Football Team) - Library
Carrie Ann Conroy (Class Clown) - Bathroom
Harold Park (Cheerleader) - English Classroom
Wilma Datlow (Valedictorian) - Science Room
Burton Fitz (Drum Major) - Band Hall
Elmer James (Mascot) - History Classroom
Minnie Franks (Student Body Prez) - Gone
Heather Hilton (President of A/V club) - Janitor’s Closet
New location based on Heather’s info:
Harold Park (Cheerleader) - Teachers’ Lounge from 6:10 to 7ish

Colored tiles

You will need to have the photo booth unlocked first. Once the photo booth is unlocked follow the directions you get for each tile.

The grid on the letter from Principal Synder’s printer might be useful.

Shift the tiles with their letters to their new location. You should have a readable message. The message will start with “Mens…”

Mens bathroom third stall ceiling tile

Where is the Third Piece of Evidence? Unlock

You will need to solve the colored tiles first. The information from this unlock will help you eliminate a suspect.

ceilingtile

Cabinet in the Band Hall Unlock

Use the hint found on the cabinet. You are looking for three letters.

The hint about falling blocks should lead you to the tetris like blocks found in the pamphlet. The three colors on the card match with some of the blocks.

Look at those groups of blocks to get the three letters you need. Arrange the letters in the same order as the stripe colors on the cabinet.

mtv

Shoot the Aliens Arcade Game

You will need to have the cabinet in the band hall unlocked to do this puzzle. Use the napkin with the aliens, the blank arcade screen, the letter grid from the pamphlet and the directions from the cabinet unlock.

Follow the directions you get from the cabinet unlock . The R and L are referring to Right and Left. Begin with R3. The directions are telling you that the ship moves right and left.

Once you shoot an alien it is out permanently. Taking a letter does not remove the alien, so it will still need to be shot if you shoot in the column again. The message you get will start with “etp…”

ET phone home
Below are examples of how the first 6 moves should play out.
The Xs show which letters get blasted and the green circles show which letters you should be using.

Phone Unlock

You will need to have solved the alien arcade puzzle before you do this unlock. Use the last word from the alien arcade puzzle solution.

Look at the phone's rotary dial to get the numbers.

4663

One more step to the prize!

These girls are this color, but the location on the map is not.

If you want to go for a drink where everybody knows your name, don't go to this reunion location on the map.

P.I.'s Ferrari, Knight's KITT, and Marty's DeLorean won't be found in the same location as the prize.

Instead, look where the first movie listed has 3 of these that are all the same, the second word's second letter of the last movie listed, and then finally the beginning letter of the second movie listed.

You have to do what's right for you. In here, it's your time. It's your time in here! That's all over the second the reunion is over. Hurry and get the prize before you end up like One-eyed Willy and the rest of his crew!

Where is the Prize Unlock

You will need to have the phone unlocked to solve this puzzle. The audio mentions how to get three letters.

The letters are found in the movie section of the pamphlet. Use the three letter word for the location.

You will find the murder weapon in this unlock.

lab

Suspect Elimination

Marshall Bradshaw - The puzzle on the skating poster reveals that the person being blackmailed (the killer) had good grades in school, so it couldn’t be Marshall since he had a 1.5 GPA.
Minnie Franks - When you solve the message on the back of the coupon and answer the question “Who left and where did they go?”, you find out that Minnie was at a bar during the time of the murder.
Heather Hilton - Heather is eliminated when you unlock the “Where is the first piece of evidence?” card. The message on the sticky note mentions the killer being a good athlete and Heather didn’t play sports so it couldn’t be her.
Wilma Datlow - Wilma was playing an arcade game during the time of the murder. You find this out once you have the survey box and arcade game unlocked.
Burton Fitz - Burton is eliminated when you unlock the “Where is the second piece of evidence?” card. The message on the sticky note mentions the killer wanting to learn an instrument back in the day. Since Burton is the drum major and knows how to play an instrument, this eliminates him as a suspect.
Harold Park - Once you have completed the map puzzle and unlocked Heather’s information, you will find that Harold was in the teachers’ lounge during the time of the murder.
Carrie Ann Conroy - Carrie Ann is eliminated when you unlock the “Where is the third piece of evidence?” card. The note found with the evidence mentions that the killer doesn’t like horror films. Based on Carrie Ann’s favorite memory you know that she likes scary movies so you can eliminate her as a suspect.

Final Solution

You will need to have every suspect eliminated and have the “where is the prize?” card unlocked.

jamescord

Message on Music Sheet

Read the message on the music from left to right.

The message will start with, “This is the…”

This is the church I was married in. The past holds so many memories. I wish I could turn back time just one hour to be with her.

Sundial Unlock

Read the paper that mentions the history of St. Benedict's Cathedral.

The first paragraph has three words that stand out. Match those words to the symbols on the sundial.

You will also need to read the message on the music sheet. There is a hint in Walter’s message. You will need to go back one hour for each of the three symbols you found.

827

Who is the person from the description on the paper found in the sundial?

You will need to solve the sundial puzzle first. The paper you find inside the sundial is describing one of the people in the mausoleum.

Read the descriptions carefully and eliminate people until only one is left.

Hint: the part about “This person was neither the eldest nor the youngest” has to do with when that person was born, not how long they have lived. Example: you might live a longer life than your parents, but you wouldn’t say you were older than your mom and dad. Remember to use what the message in the sundial mentioned for the unlock

Paul Hughes

Graveyard Unlock

You will need to solve the sundial puzzle first. The paper you find inside the sundial is describing one of the people in the mausoleum.

Read the descriptions carefully and eliminate people until only one is left. Hint: the part about “This person was neither the eldest nor the youngest” has to do with when that person was born, not how long they have lived. Example: you might live a longer life than your parents, but you wouldn’t say you were older than your mom and dad

Remember to use what the message in the sundial mentioned.

hughes1933

Music Note Puzzle

You will need to solve the mausoleum puzzle first. The message from Walter in the mausoleum unlock is your hint for this puzzle: “I have always marched to the beat of my own drum. I don’t follow conventional wisdom nor do I use the common standards. Just look to my words to understand what I mean.”

When you go to translate the music notes into letters do not use the standard ABCDEFG. Instead use Walter's own words from the music sheet you read earlier to help you translate the notes

Notice that the letters on the music sheet show up on the same line each time. The message will start with “look…”

“Look under the second pew.”

Church Unlock

You will need to solve the mausoleum puzzle first. The message from Walter in the mausoleum unlock is your hint for this puzzle: “I have always marched to the beat of my own drum. I don’t follow conventional wisdom nor do I use the common standards. Just look to my words to understand what I mean.”

When you go to translate the music notes into letters do not use the standard ABCDEFG. Instead use Walter's own words from the music sheet you read earlier to help you translate the notes

Notice that the letters on the music sheet show up on the same line each time. The message will start with “look…”

secondpew

Shooting Gallery Unlock

Read the message Walter wrote on the back of the shooting gallery poster carefully.

Walter mentions three animals his wife loved. What was on her hair clip? What animal did she jump into the river to get? What kind of person would she be if not for her allergies?

Also make note of Walter’s comment “I could never harm something that my wife held dear.” This means don’t shoot those animals, shoot what is left. What word do you get?

engaged

Ferris Wheel

You will need to solve the shooting gallery puzzle first. Use the directions you get from the shooting gallery unlock with the Ferris wheel.

The message found by the Ferris Wheel has three hints to help with this puzzle. "Where you get on is where you start. Now enjoy the ride as the Ferris wheel turns. Where you stop is what you get." Start at the bottom (where you get on), the directions you get are about the wheel turning, not you moving (Ferris wheel turns), and each turn will get you a letter (where you stop is what you get).

So if the wheel were turned six places counterclockwise, what letter is now at the bottom? Hint: the first three letters are “USE”.

“Use only even numbers.”

Axe Throwing and Toys on Shelves

You will need to solve the Ferris wheel puzzle first. The Axe Throwing booth and the toys on the shelves go together.

If you count how many numbers and toys are in each row you will find that they match each. So each number goes with a toy. Using the answer from the Ferris wheel, “Use only even numbers”, take note of which animals on each shelf would be left.

Now find the letter for each animal and read the message you get. The message will start with “take a…”

Take a ride on the Tumbler

What Ride? Unlock

You will need to solve the Ferris wheel puzzle first. The Axe Throwing booth and the toys on the shelves go together.

If you count how many numbers and toys are in each row you will find that they match each. So each number goes with a toy. Using the answer from the Ferris wheel, “Use only even numbers”, take note of which animals on each shelf would be left.

Now find the letter for each animal and read the message you get. The message will start with “take a…”

thetumbler

Coded Message

Use the translated note from the beginning to translate the coded message.

The message will start with “Take the rope…”

“Take the rope and place one end on the western bird’s beak. Swing the other end wide and see what it touches. The monster’s location plus this word will open the way.”

String

You will need to decipher the coded message first. Follow the directions you get from the coded message

You will get a six letter word

canopy

Card with UFO and Letters

There is an icon in the bottom right corner of this paper. This icon is also on something else you have. Look through the “Strange and Crazy World” tabloid carefully.

On the last page of the magazine there are five movie posters from “End of the Line” Cinema. Read the titles for all of the movies. Each title has a direction mentioned in it.

Use the directions to get five letters from the grid, the UFO is the starting point. The name of the production company is a hint, “End of the Line.” When you move down from the UFO, move all the way down and you will get the letter B.

beast

Monster Matching

If you read the article about “Monster Sightings” in the magazine and the report about strange tracks in Easthaven Forest, you will be able to match the tracks to the monsters.

The last set of tracks match to the beast.

Dear and Feather Unlock

You will need to solve the string puzzle, letter grid, and monster track puzzle to unlock this.

Use the ending location for the monster named in the letter grid puzzle with the word you got by solving the string puzzle.

namingtreecanopy

Three Circular Items and The Map

You will need to have unlocked the “Dear and Feather” card BEFORE you try this puzzle. The map has three distinct circles on it.

You have found three circular items. Place each item on its appropriate circle.

Use the directions you get from the “Deer and Feather” unlock.

St. Benedict Medal

Place the medal on the small circle so that the shapes on the side of the circle line up with the letters on the medal.

Solution: sm

Ring Toss

Place the ring toss ring on the medium circle.

It will cover the outer ring of letters leaving four in the center.

Solution: okey

The Crystal Tavern Coaster

Place the coaster on the largest circle.

Follow the directions specified in the “Deer and Feather” unlock, these are the green directions.

When it says “From the second takes its first”, it is referring to the words and letters. From the second word on the coaster, take its first letter.

Solution: cave

Where is the treasure? Unlock

You will need to solve the circles on the map puzzle to unlock this.

smokeycave

Stone Door

Look closely at what each stick figure is holding.

Have you seen any of these items before?Take another look through the tabloid.

The page you need is titled “What to Bring Cryptid Hunting.” Each item is numbered. Use the numbers for each item in the order they are depicted in the cave to unlock the stone door.

5214

Final Solution

You will need to have solved all of the puzzles to unlock this. Eliminate suspects as you find them. Then use the last name of the killer(remaining suspect) with the number used to open the stone door

vanderburg5214

“Help ” Letter/ True and False

Read through the 48 true/false statements on the back of the “Help!” note.

Use the cork board as a reference for any questions you are unsure about.

Using the Hemingway Heights map, eliminate any houses that have a false statement with their number. Example: on number 4 the statement is false since New York’s nickname is the Big Apple, not the Big Orange. This means you can mark out house number 4.

1. True     20. True
2. True     21. True
3. True     22. False
4. False    23. True
5. True     24. True
6. False    25. True
7. True     26. True
8. False    27. True
10. True    28. True
11. True    29. True
12. True    30. False
13. True    31. True
14. True    32. False
15. True    33. False
15. True    34. False
16. False   35. True
18. False   36. True
19. False   37. False
38. False   44.False
39. False   45.False
40. False   46.False
41. False   47. True
42. True    48. True
43. False   

Lawn Boy

Joshua Ridgeley needs some help with his geometry homework. He has mentioned it has something to do with the sum(addition) of each row and column. If you look carefully at the grid you will notice that the top row of numbers does not have any question marks. Use this as a starting point. Find the sum of the top row. This will give you the value of the triangle.

Once you know the value of the triangle you can figure out what number needs to replace the ? in the first column, since it will have the same sum as the first row since they are both marked with triangles. Hint: triangles = 17, so the total for each row and column marked with a triangle needs to equal 17. That mean that the ? in the first column needs to be replaced with a 3. Use this thinking to complete the rest of the grid. Use the four numbers that replaced the ? to access the QR code. The information you get from Joshua will help you eliminate some houses.

3645

Lab Tech

Amber mentions that this puzzle has something to do with the little league poster. Look at the top of the little league poster.

The icon with the 4 letters is what you will need to use with the letter grid on the back of Amber’s card. Use the line as a path and trace out the path on the letter grid to get a message. Start at the letter U.

The first word you will get is “unlock.” The information you get from Amber will help you eliminate some houses. Use the information from Amber with the HOA’s list of homes.

discipline

Number from Vet Clinic Worker

Scan the QR code on the back of the Vet Clinic card and listen to the audio.

“We found one of those microchips that some owners get for their dogs. We called the number we pulled from the scan. The number was for a company called VetTech. They were able to get us the dog owner's contact information. Unfortunately, it is against the clinic's policy to give out the owner's information. I don't want to lose my job. At the same time, I understand that this is a bit of an emergency. I have an idea. The owner’s phone number is a local number. So, it should be pretty easy to figure out what the first six digits of the phone number are. To get the last four digits of the phone number, take the year the clinic was founded and multiply that number by the number of animals in our logo. Finally, add in the total number of barks that you have heard during this conversation. The total should give you the last four digits of the dog owner’s phone number.”

There are 17 barks.

1954 x 3 =
5862 + 17 = 5879

Dog Owner ’ s Phone number

You will need to listen to the Animal Clinic worker to solve this.

The worker mentions that the phone number you need is a local number so the first six digits are the same as other local numbers. Look through the items you have to find a local number so you can get the first six digits.

To get the last four digits listen and follow the directions given by the Animal Clinic worker. The information you get from this will help you eliminate some houses.

2025555879

Which Mary?

Read through the “Help!” note to figure out which Mary wrote the note.

In the note she mentions things like her family status, her hand, and her name.

Mary Diana James

Based on the information in the “Help!” note you can determine that the Mary that wrote the note is married with children, right handed, and has Mary as her first name.

How to Eliminate Houses

1. Use the information Mary provides about the exterior of the house and the HOA list to eliminate some of the houses based on their exterior.

Use the list of true and false statements on the back of the help note to eliminate some houses based on their house number.

Use the information you get from Amber and the HOA list to eliminate some of the houses based on their tree type.

Use the information you get from Joshua and the HOA list to eliminate some of the houses based on their grass type.

Use the information you get from Charlie’s owner and the HOA list to eliminate some of the houses based on their flower type.

Last name of the kidnapper and last name of the author of the help note.

You will need to have solved all previous puzzles before you attempt to unlock this.

bainjames

Transcript for the Reel-to-Reel Recorder in Eddie ’ s House

“Mary, Mary, quite contrary
What have you gone and done?
With all my skills and Helena feels
I’ll be sure to find the one
I’ll be sure to find the one”

Current Path/Door One

The letters you need for the nodes are on the notebook paper that has Eddie’s notes.

Like the notes about door one say, you will need to figure out which nodes you need to move to make a clear path for the current to pass through.
Example: Moving this metal circle up will unblock that part of the path

The letters you get from the nodes the current passes through will spell a word.

dangerous

Two gears/Door Two

Use the image of the two gears with the notes about door two and the “HEADACHE” message in Eddie's notes. Use the word HEADACHE with the letters on the gear.

Starting with H you should see that H corresponds to the number 8 on the numbered gear. You are told that the numbered gear can spin. The direction under the H on Eddie’s notes has a 2 with a clockwise turn. If the numbered gear was turned 2 moves clockwise the 6 would now correspond to the H. So H gives you 6. (See the first image below)

Remember Eddie’s hint about always coming back to the beginning. This means the numbered gear will reset back to its starting point each time. The next letter is E. After you turn the numbered gear 3 click counter-clockwise 8 is now where the 6 was located. So 8 corresponds to E. (See the second image below). So your first two numbers you have gotten from the H and the E are 68.

68578153

Dots and numbers/Door Three

Use the notes about door three to help you solve this puzzle.

The notes have a few hints. The amount of each color is not useful, so don’t count. Rearrange your thinking, so you will need to move some stuff around.

There is a tracing feature over the dots, so you will have to trace something, after you have rearranged them. The # with the arrows is your clue on how to rearrange the numbers. Rearrange the numbers from least to greatest. Then write out the dots with their adjacent numbers. Example: the first two rows would look like this

If you don’t have colored markers or pens you can always use letters to represent the colors.
Example: instead of make Red, Red, Green, Green circle/dots you can write out
R R G G

571

Pills and Pill Organizer

You will need to have solved the first 3 doors before attempting this puzzle. As you unlock the first three doors you will find a pill in each room.

You will get an identification number for each pill. Once you have all three, follow the directions on the paper under the pill organizer. The references about Morning, Noon, Evening, and Bedtime are each connected to one of the 4 parts of the pill organizer.

The first clue states “The letter found in between the two letters at the center.” In the first section there are three pills, two of which have letters. Using the letters A and K what is alphabetically in between them at the center?

A B C D E F G H I J K

As you can see F is at the center between A and K.
Follow the other directions to get the rest of the code.

You will need to have solved the first 3 doors before attempting this puzzle.

f859 You get f from the morning section by using the letters A and K and finding what alphabetically in between them at the center?
A B C D E F G H I J K

As you can see F is at the center between A and K.

You get 8 from the Noon section by adding the 2 and the 6.
You get the 5 from the evening section because it is the only odd number.
You get 9 from the bedtime section because it is the largest single digit.

Door 4 Unlock

You will need to have solved the first 3 doors before attempting this puzzle. Use the answer you got from the pill organizer puzzle to unlock this door.

Make sure to look at the keypad when you enter the code.

3859

Ankle Monitor

Use the record log for the ankle monitor that is normal to translate the encrypted logs.

The message at the top of the page that has the company's name, slogan, and phone number is the same for both pages. So you can use this to help you translate the rest of the document.

Compare dates to the time and date in the chat transcript.

Torn letter

Mentally piece together the torn up piece of paper.

Compare dates to the time and date in the chat transcript.

You will also need to look at an item from part one to know who to eliminate.

Message hidden in the chat transcript

“Helena” sent Eddie a secret message on March 8th that she said he would have to decipher.

Fill the letters and words as you decipher the message. What you see with: eye=I

13th letter in the alphabet: m . Opposite of far + shortened word you say when hanging up the phone: near +bye = nearby. So the message will start with, “I’m nearby…”

“I'm nearby, not house with two odd digits.”

Username Search

Read through the chat transcripts to find Helena’s username.

Use this on the Night Out website.

The web address can be found on the drink koozie.

helena314

Submit Find Love Faster Questionnaire answers

Match “Helena’s” answers to the “Find Lover Faster” questionnaire.

Use the numbers you get to unlock the FIND LOVE FASTER search on the Night Out Dating website.

It is located under the Username Search.

3228264

Suspect Elimination

Jake Blecher coaches the Bear Cubs little league team. Based on the little league poster from part 1, Jake would have been at a game on March 8th during the time the catfisher was talking with Eddie.


Michele was at the courthouse on March 4th during the time “Helena” was talking with Eddie. So she could not be the catfisher.


Jacqueline is eliminated when the catfisher gives out information about themselves in the chat transcripts about their house number. “Not house with two odd digits” Since Jacqueline’s house number is 31, you can eliminate her.


Chad can be eliminated as a suspect when you piece together the torn-up letter. The letter reveals that the HOA vice president, which you know is Chad based on the HOA letter from part one, is out of the country without technology on March 9th. So he couldn’t have talked with Eddie on that date.


Final Solution

You will need to have all suspects eliminated and have completed the search on the Night Out website.

davidwarning

Stalker Scratch Letter

The scratch marks on the letters can be found in another place.

Look through Allison’s planner. On February 3, Allison made a note about finding scratch marks on her door.

The marks on her door are the order you need to read the letters on the stalker’s note. Start by reading the letters that have 3 scratches. The message will start with “I love to watch…”.

“I love to watch you work. You looked so beautiful in your new blue suit during your meeting.”

Stalker “Thinking of You Card”

Start with the doodles. The stalker copied Allison’s doodles from her planner. Look through the planner and see if you can find anything that would connect the doodles to the list in the card. Each doodle is on its own day

What is the day’s date for each doodle? The rose is on the 1st so it would be 1. Use the planner to assign each doodle its number, then compare the numbers to the list in the card.

Use the first letter in the words from the list to translate the doodles. Since the rose is on the 1st it is one and the word that goes with one on the list is “Noble.” So, the rose should be translated as N. The message will start with “I love…”

“I love watching you jog in the morning.”

Stalker Text Message and Grid

The text message has numbers and letters that stand out. Each sentence has one letter and one number that go together. In the first sentence you will get T8.

Use T8 with the grid on the purple paper. You will get “I”

The message will start with “I didn’t…”

“I didn’t know you liked to play frisbee.”

Stalker Letter on Product Rise paper

Allison's stolen ID badge was returned to her work desk along with a note. This is the note on the Product Rise paper. There are two red letters written by the stalker on Allison’s ID badge. There is a hint about the start point in the P.S. message on the Product Rise paper.

It mentions going from empty to filled. Start at the empty circle and work your way to the filled circle.Starting at I, use the path on the ID badge as a guide to navigate the letter grid on the Produce Rise paper.

You will get a readable message if you follow it correctly. The first I on the second row is the one you need to start at. The message will start with “I liked…”

“I liked watching you paint last night.”

Stalker “Nothing Between Us” note

This puzzle has two hints. One is on the paper itself when the stalker writes “I will remove anything that comes between us.”

The second hint can be found in Allison’s planner on February 15. Allison found the image of a man and woman holding hands and the words “Nothing Between Us.” Use these hints to remove certain letters and read what is left.

Remove all of the letters that are in between a man and a woman icon and read what is left. The message will start with “Who did you…”

“Who did you meet at cafe torrefie noir for coffee?”

The Omnis Enim Scientia's Door

Use the information that Zach Farris gives you with the symbols Justin Harris found around the door. The letters and symbols are broken into two groups.Make sure to keep them as two groups.

Follow the instructions about shifting the letters for the top section. If A shifts 5 to the right and then 2 the to left then A goes with the globe symbol. Make sure that all of the letters in the top section stay in the top section. This means that the K, L and M would just cycle back to the front.

Follow the instructions for the bottom set. So if N shifts 7 to the left and 2 to the right N would be on the empty vial symbol. The message will start with “Speak the…”

“Speak the words art and craft to enter.”

Code: artcraf

Gym Locker

James mentions that the gym owner has a strange way of setting the locks for the lockers. Read Sebastian Ballard's interview which is found in the case notes. Use the numbers from the coupon Sebastian gives you with what is written on the locker.

Each of the weights in the coupon have a color and a number. In the message on the locker match the things to their traditional colors and use the numbers from the weights to complete the math.

Ex. “What is the difference between a clear sky and the sun?”Difference means subtraction and the sky is typical blue and the sun is yellow. So you should get 10 - 2 which gives you 8.

Code: 8248

Israel’ s Apartment Door

Israel mentions that he specializes in weird designs. Use his business card with his door to get four numbers

The business card gives you the order you need. Count the number of times each design is used on Israel’s door.

Ex. The first design mentioned on the card is skulls and there are three skulls on the door. So the first number is three.

Code: 3721

Douglas ’ Apartment Door

You will need to have unlocked Israel’s apartment first. Look carefully at the album sleeves. There is something subtle that each one has in common.

The first letter in each of the band’s names is underlined. In the notes that Israel has about his neighbors he lists out the songs that Douglas is always listening to when he gets home from work.

Match the songs to the albums and use the underlined letters. The first three letters you get will be O, N, and E.

Code: 1905

Leonard’ s email

In Leonard’s conversation he talks about his favorite superheroes.

The initials TS, GT, and MG are for Thunder Speed, Giga Titan, and Mighti Gal.

Use their names to answer the four questions in Leonard’s email hint to get four letters. The first letter you get will be P.

Code: path

Antonio ’ s Safe

The sticky note on Antonio’s safe is a hint.

Read Allsion’s description of Antonio.

Code: adonis

Ryan ’ s Briefcase

You will need to have the Anontio’s safe unlocked first. Inside Antonio’s safe you find a paper he has stolen from Ryan Knox

On the paper the phrase Carpe Diem is broken into three parts. Use the image of the phone keypad page to find the numerical value of each letter. Ex. C=2, A=2, and R=7

Then add up the numbers in each section. The first section will equal 11.

Code: 111016

Who is left to Investigate? unlock

You will need to have solved all puzzles up to this point and have eliminated 6 of the 9 suspects.

aschir

Finger and Toe Puzzle

Match up the image of the painted fingers and toes with the wooden blocks. There are ten blocks in the top row and ten on the bottom row. The top row corresponds to the fingers, and the bottom row corresponds to the toes.

The numbers on the blocks give the order for which letters to pull. Ex. the number 1 is on the first block on the bottom row, so use the first letter from the toes, which is I. Then the number 2 is on the fifth block on the top row, so use the fifth letter from the fingers which is S.

The message will start with “I saw…”

“I saw u dance.”

Polaroid Puzzle

The backs of the Polaroids have two configurations. Arranging the Polaroids so that you can read the message made with the larger letters will give you a hint on how to solve the spiral in the eye.

The hint, “My love will always surround U” emphasizes the U. The letters in the spiral are in groups of three. Starting on the outside, work your way into the center

Pull out and use any group that has U in the middle. Read just the letters to either side of the Us. The message will start with “Hey…”

“Hey Honey I loved watching you have fun at the concert”

The Watcher Has a Nickname for Allison

You will need to solve the Polaroid puzzle first.

Use the nickname the stalker gives Allison in the Polaroid puzzle.

honey

Saint George ’ s Hospital Children's Center Unlock

You will need to solve the finger and toe puzzle first.

Use the message you get from the stalk in the finger and toe puzzle to fill in the blanks.

Then use the letters with stars under them to make a word.

sane

You will need to have the “The Watcher has a nickname for Allison” unlocked before you can do this.

Follow the instructions Phil gives you for the phone number.

The first three numbers will be 202.

2025550543

Antonio ’ s Text Message

You will need to have the “Saint George’s Hospital Children’s Center” unlocked before you can do this.

FLUK3 gives you a hint about decoding the text message. “Just begin as you normally would...at the beginning.”

Use the first letter in each word to decode the message. It will start with “Meet at…”

“Meet at seven in the park tonight. Bring the package”

“I will be there.”

“It was good to see you. Sincerely Antonio”

You ' re closing in on The Watcher!

You will need to have the “The Watcher has a nickname for Allison” and the “Saint George’s Hospital Children’s Center”unlocked before you can do this.

You will need to solve the puzzles given to you by Phil and FLUK3. Once you have eliminated the remaining two suspects you should have everything you need to complete the unlock.

Remember to get the words you need from Phil and FLUK3.

chlawtruth

Roses are Red Puzzle

You will need to have the “You're closing in on The Watcher!” unlocked before you can do this. Use the list of letters and numbers that you get from the unlock with the “Rose are red” poem.

Use the letters to get to the correct line in the poem and use the numbers to pull out the correct letter from that line.

Ex. The first letter and number combination on the list is E2. So go to line E and pull out the second letter, which is C.

Carl Henry

You will need to have solved all puzzles at this point.

Shorthand messages on napkins

Jeff Berry mentions something about the crew hands writing messages to each other using shorthand.

Use the vowels that Jeff gives you with the letters found on the napkin to create words. The letters are already in the correct order.

The first message will start with “Who keeps eating all of…”

Who keeps eating all the pizza?

I think it was one of the ladies

Ya, my guess is Luz, her manager won’t let her eat most of the time,

I agree, I have seen her sneaking food to her room.

Man I feel sorry for her, must be close to starving.

Hey do any of you know what happened to the safe? The password changed again.

Someone must have opened it. One of the producers has it set to change the password every time it is used. Try the next one in the sequence. I believe it is the seventh one.

Untangling the wires unlock

First, untangle the wires by following each path from the number to the letter. Make note of the order of the letter you get from 1 through 6. The first letter is E.

Second, look on the circuit board and pay attention to the grouping of letters.

Since E was the first letter you got from untangling the wires, look at the group of Es. Notice that they are around the word RIGHT. That is the first word in the message you are trying to get. Once you have the whole message follow the directions and enter the code.

Part one esgdvt

I think it was one of the ladies

tvdgse is used to unlock the file

Safe

You will need to have solved the messages on the second napkin before you can complete this puzzle. The message on the second napkin mentions that the safe password is a code that changes. The message also mentions that the code follows a pattern

The numbers on the sticky note form a pattern. Examine the pattern in the first digit of each sequence. Examine the pattern in the second digit of each sequence.Continue with each additional digit, determining the pattern.

010880

010880

034575

050870

094565

110860

??????

??????-This is the number you are trying to determine.

Example

First digit-If you examine the pattern, you will notice that the numbers are increasing as 10,880 goes up to 34,575, etc. So when you get to 1 for the number 110860 the next logical number in the chain is also 1.

Second digit-The numbers go from 1 to 3 to 5 to 9 and then back to 1. So the next digit in that sequence is 3 and so on.

150850

Horoscope

You will need to have unlocked the wires QR code before doing this puzzle. Cut out the zodiac tiles.

You will only need seven of the zodiac tiles for this puzzle. Use the information from the horoscope to get each zodiac sign in the correct order

Hint: Leo is in the center. Once done you will need to know which person goes with which sign. This information is obtained from Kaitlin and from the wires unlock

Scorpio, Virgo, Taurus, Leo, Capricorn, Cancer, Aries

Who can you trust? unlock

Solve the horoscope puzzle to unlock this file.

tccancer

The first part of the message will start with “My love…”

Recipe

You will need to search the east suite in order to work this puzzle. Check the kitchen to find the clue you need.

The message you find on the counter mentions the recipe is as easy as A,B,C, which is a hint that this relates to the alphabet. The message also mentions you should number using the odds.

Write out the alphabet and then number the letters using only odd numbers. So A=1, B=3, C=5, etc. The first part of the recipe will read “Cook on…”

Cook on the stove for thirty minutes stirring constantly.

Transcript for the Whispered Conversation in the East Suite

Sarah: “Rob, what do you mean it is a fake?”

Rob: “Just that Sarah, this isn't the real McClain medallion. I would know, I saw it enough times growing up.”

Sarah: “That means someone else got to it before me, but how? Your father finished his speech at 9:10 and I went up there around 9:40. That leaves only a half hour window.”

Rob: “Don’t worry about it. I will think of something, for now let’s keep this to ourselves.”

Puzzle #1 Family Tree Puzzle

You will need to read the information on the back of each of the suspects’ cards. Use the family tree to help you see how the different families are grouped.

Rebecca’s family is “the family that has the mother’s name.”

The family member you can eliminate as a suspect is the youngest in the family of three.

Lindsay

Puzzle #2...Another Unworthy

Try to picture what each box would look like if you placed them on top of each other going down.

Each column of boxes will form a letter.

The first letter is R

Rob is unworthy

Puzzle #3...The Key

You will need to solve puzzle 1 and 2 before you can do this one. Follow the directions on the card marked with keys.

If you have solved puzzles 1 and 2 you should get: lindsayrobcefghjkmpqtuvwxz

Use this to translate the coded message on puzzle number 3. The message will start “A hot head…”

A hot head like Stephen will ruin the family.
Look at the bust in the study.

What in the study should you examine?

You will need to solve puzzle number 3 to unlock this.

Use the underlined part on the message to unlock the file.

thebust

Puzzle #4...Strange Symbols

You will need to have unlocked the “What in the study should you examine?” QR code. On the message you find under the bust you will see symbols that match those found on puzzle number 4.

The symbols are above and below each letter they represent. Use this to fill in letters on puzzle number 4. Once you have, you will notice that there are still a few letters missing.

Fill in the letters for each symbol so that the message makes sense. The message will start with “Why would the…”

Why would the man stuck in second despite his age be chosen?

Forensic Unlock

You need to have solved the recipe and listened to the whispered conversation from the east suite to unlock this.

rebeccasarah

Finger Prints

Compare the oil from the fingerprint to the list of oil types.

Then compare the fingerprint to the list of fingerprints you have for each suspect.

This, paired with information found on Stephen’s card, will help you eliminate a suspect.

The oily fingerprint matches Kyle’s fingerprint.

Phone numbers

Compare the list of suspects’ phone numbers to the call logs you have from the cell tower.

Make note of the time.

This information, paired with information found on Lindsay’s card, will help you eliminate a suspect.

Joshua’s phone number matches a number on the cell tower log list.

Puzzle #5...Blueprint

You will need to have unlocked the forensic envelope first.

Use the information found in puzzle number 5 and the blueprint to find the correct room. The clue about “eliminate the rooms that start with 11, 4, or 7” is referring to a numbered alphabet.

So eliminate any rooms that start with K, D, or G

pantry

Puzzle #6...Ice Cream

You will need to have the “Wealth and Fortune” envelope unlocked first. Use the ice cream card with puzzle number 6.

Notice that the colors of the rectangles match the colors of the ice cream scoops. Place the card in each rectangle in order of the ice cream scoops

There should be a letter that lines up with the hole on the card. The first letter you get is N

Not Nick

Puzzle #7...A Queen

You will need to have the “Wealth and Fortune” envelope unlocked first. Puzzle number 7 mentions a queen. Do you have an item that would go with that?

Pay close attention to the queen on the card. She is holding something in her hand.

Use the red lens on the back of the queen’s card.

Amber doesn’t care about the medallion

Puzzle #8...The List and The Photo

Have you seen the items in the list on puzzle 8 anywhere?

Look carefully at the photo of junk and match the item in the photo to the items on the list. There will be 6 items on the list that do not match with any item in the photo.

You will then need to unscramble the letters to get the word you need.

closet

Where is the Medallion Unlock

You will need to solve Puzzle number 8.

closet

She Lacks Weight/Newspaper Clippings

The newspaper clippings have symbols on them. You need to read the articles to find the values of each symbol.

The dollar sign is worth 1. Use that as a starting point. Based on the article, silver is worth 9 dollars. So Silver is 9.

You will need to read both of the last two articles to figure out the value of the shield, axe, and eagle.

: 11/26/93

Who is the thief?

Use the underlined word from “Where is the Medallion?” unlock with the thief’s name to unlock this file.

heirloomcrystal

Note From Sinclair

Poker Rules

Who Won The Poker Game?

Confront the Killer?

Solution Card (Who Killed Sinclair LeCompt?)



Envelope 1

One of the first objectives that Sinclair instructs you to complete is to determine which game piece and Secret card corresponds to each suspect.

Colored Game Pieces: The back of each suspect card contains information that will identify which color of game piece represents them. Read carefully.

Secret Cards: Assigning the correct secret to the right suspect involves playing the game (see next page).

Game Board

Once you know who corresponds to each color, you can play the board game.

Sinclair has provided what each player rolls for their first 4 turns. Determine what the final number each color lands on

Take note of the rule in the bottom right hand corner of the game board. Example: Red rolls 3, rolls 2, rolls 5, and rolls 3. By moving the red piece along the game board according to the number of each roll, you will land on 13. However, the second roll landed you on a gift which is worth an additional 2 points. So Red ends with a final score of 15, complete for all colors. Once you know what color corresponds to each suspect you can use the information Sinclair provides on the hotel stationery to also determine what their secret is.

Scores/Secrets:


Red-15 (mobster): Harlan McAllister

Green-20 (drug-dealer): Lucy Vu

Black-35 (kleptomaniac): Mona Allegra

Blue-32 (ex-con): Jackson Ellis

White-36 (smuggler): Diego Murillo

Yellow-33 (assassin): Frederick Ellsworth

Briefcase

Notice that opening the briefcase requires 6 digits to unlock (3 digit combination on the left and 3 digit combination on the right)

Once you know each player’s total score for the game you can use the 6 digits to gain access to the briefcase

The note on top of the briefcase tells you which players and the order to use their scores.

361520

Safe

Once you have opened the briefcase, you will get a very helpful piece of information that will tell you how to access the safe.

Pay special attention to what colors need to be added together to make other colors

This indicates that you should add the values of the two colors to equal the value of the colors drawn on the safe. Ex: yellow + red = orange (so add yellow and red’s scores to get the value for orange). Pay special attention to Sinclair’s note at the bottom of the color wheel.

464764

Wardrobe

Once you gain access to the safe, there is a note from Sinclair with instructions about a secret he discovered behind the wardrobe.

He lists 4 very specific locations that you should search. Scan the Search Sinclair LeCompt’s room and click on each of the places he instructs in his letter.

Enter the numbers in order according to the letter. Proceed and pay special attention. This unlock eliminates a suspect

8274

Envelope With Bottle Symbol:

Start by reading Rosemary Clark’s thoughts, the newspaper article, and Sinclair’s notes.

Sinclair mentions a secret in the piano. Accessing this is the first goal of the Envelope #2.

Grid Puzzle

This puzzle is designed to be completed 5 different times (one for each mobster)

Each gangster has a set of directions on the back of their photo that should be used to navigate the grid. Begin at the star each time. The first and last letter for each gangster’s puzzle corresponds to their specific color.

The same colors are attached to each last name as they were in the tabletop game from Sinclair’s hotel room. (Example: Lucy Vu corresponds to the green game piece in part 1 so Harold Vu’s directions begin at the green letter.) You should end up with two or three words for each gangster that are formed from letters from the grid using their specific directions. Example: Harold’s directions say, “Can move diagonally in any direction one space at a time.” Begin on the star and go to the green letter which is an F. Using the rule and moving around the grid, you can create the words “First Black Key” which ends on the green letter Y. Repeat this process for all 5 gangsters. First three steps for each gangster below

Harold Vu: “First Black Key”

Carmine Allegra: “White Four”

Len Murillo: “Sixth Black”

Bert Ellsworth: “Fifth White Key”

Sonny McAllister: “Last Key”

*See below for a diagram on how each was solved.


Piano Keys/Old Piano

Once you have successfully gotten the message associated with each gangster, you will notice that it refers you to a specific piano key

Example: Vu from the previous step’s puzzle says, “First Black Key.” The letter on the first black key of the piano is E.

Find the correct letter that corresponds to each gangster. Use the order of the names at the bottom of the piano keys to tell you the correct order to use the letters. You will be spelling a 5 letter word. Once you have the word you can use it to unlock the secret hidden in the old piano.

booze

Elevator/Emerald Carter

When reading the back of Emerald Carter’s photograph, her handwritten note mentions a secret elevator

The combination requires a specific set of ingredients. You should have found the recipe for this drink inside the piano (see previous step).

Note: pay special attention to what Emerald says about diluting the ingredients. Consult the ingredients listed on each of the 3 drink recipes and reduce those specific numbers by the amount Emerald tells you in her note. Unlock the secret elevator, eliminate another suspect by what you learn. You then open the envelope sealed with the Elevator Symbol

1525330

Elevator Envelope/Poker Game

Sinclair’s last communication to you talks about a poker game and instructs you to determine who won

There are 3 hands of poker (one on the back of each book cover). Play out each hand using the mini deck of cards and the poker hand rankings guide to see which gangster is the winner of each hand. One of the gangsters wins 2 out of 3 and would be considered the winner of the game

Use the full name of the gangster who won the 1931 poker game to unlock the card. You should be able to eliminate two additional suspects after unlocking the file

Round 1: Allegra wins

Round 2: Vu wins

Round 3: Allegra wins


Allegra wins the most hands in the poker game.

Confront the Killer?

After determining the winner of the card game, you will receive one part of the information needed to unlock this card.

The second part can be found by consulting the Will Street Detective Agency business card and going to their Facebook page

227greed

Who Killed Sinclair LeCompt?

After confronting the killer, you should have enough evidence and have eliminated enough suspects to know who murdered Sinclair LeCompt?

Use the killer’s first name and their secret to unlock the file.

monaklepto

Peanut Butter Ball Recipe


Candy Suckers

The candy suckers seem to form a pattern. What would the missing spot contain if the pattern was complete?

The shape pattern goes Star, Circle, Spiral, Star, Circle, Spiral...etc. The number pattern seems to increase by 1 for the ones underlined with blue and decrease by 1 for the ones underlined with red

This will let you eliminate a suspect. If you think about what the answer is referring to, maybe reviewing some of the other evidence will help you make the connection. Look at the reviews for the candy shops and you should be able to figure out who to eliminate as a suspect.

2 starsp>

Sara’s Golden Chocolates

You have found two pieces of evidence that are from Sara’s Golden Chocolates. When you compare the two, what is similar between them?

There are four shapes on the candy bars that match the four shapes on the candy names circle. Use the candy bars as the order and pull the bold letters out.

Unscramble the four words you get. This will eliminate a suspect

“Sara isn’t the killer”

Fudge Recipe and Shopping List

The shopping list mentions baking. If you compare the fudge recipe to the shopping list what do you get?

There are some items that are on both the shopping list and the ingredients list. The shopping list mentions keeping things in order. Use the shopping list as the order and pull number from the recipe.

You should get four numbers. The shopping list also mentions the words “brief” and “case” this should give you an idea of where to use the four numbers.

2813

Briefcase Unlock

You need to solve the recipe and shopping list puzzle to unlock the briefcase. The shopping list mentions baking. If you compare the fudge recipe to the shopping list what do you get?

There are some items that are on both the shopping list and the ingredients list. The shopping list mentions keeping things in order. Use the shopping list as the order and pull number from the recipe.

You should get four numbers. The shopping list also mentions the words “brief” and “case” this would give you an idea of where to use the four numbers.

2813

Mints

You need to get the briefcase opened first.

You will need to have all three mints to solve this puzzle

The letters are in the correct order just fill them all in and you will get a three word message. This will let you eliminate a suspect if you use the schedule.

“Not October Twelfth”

Assorted Chocolates

You need to get the briefcase opened first. Once the briefcase is opened you should be able to get the assorted chocolates in the correct order to get a message.

Match the assorted chocolates to the chocolates found in the briefcase to get the letters in the correct order to read the message.

This will help you eliminate two suspects.

“It’s not one of the bakers”

Which Shop Unlock

You need to solve all of the puzzles up to this point and have eliminated all but one suspect. On the next page is a suspect elimination methods list. WARNING this will contain spoilers!

gc

Peanut Butter Ball Recipe

Follow the hand written directions on the recipe to get the numbers you need

You should end up with seven digits.

3660186

Final Solution

Get the name from what Doris Goody’s granddaughter tells you. Then get the numbers from the peanut butter ball recipe.

Follow the hand written directions on the recipe to get the numbers you need

You should end up with seven digits.

gladwell3660186

Collectible Card Spider Sticker

Blue Spider Card/Music Notes

The blue spider card has music notes on one side. You should have another item that also has music notes.

If you look at the business card for “Hear the King,” you will notice that the name of the store is spelled out on music notes.

Match the music notes from the spider card to the business card to get the hidden message. You will get three words.

three nine eight

Red Spider Card/Word Search

You will find a paper among the evidence that gives a hint about a word search.

Use the red spider card with the hotel poster. The seven key words from the poster are what you should be searching for.

If you trace where each word is found you will create two numbers.

97

Grey Spider Card/Letters With Arrows

The Spider left a message for you at the end of their letter. The hint about climbing is important. Is there anything among the evidence that relates to climbing?

The business card for New Heights Climbing Company has three arrows on it. Is there anything else among the evidence that has arrows on it? Use the arrows from the business card with the grey spider card to translate the message from The Spider by moving up twice and then right once on the letter grid on the back of the grey spider card.

The first letter is Q, so this translates to F when you move up twice and right once. The message you get will start with “Fiddles…”

Fiddles plus stars, then times the legs of a spider
3+7 = 10
10x8 = 80
80

Yellow Spider Card/ Flowers

The back of the yellow spider card has a list of names. Where else among the evidence have you seen those names?

Using the flower shop poster, match the names of the flowers to the images of the flowers.

Pull the letters from the shop name that have the flowers that match the list from the yellow spider card. The first letter you get should be D.

DECIMAL

Purple Spider Card/Three symbols

Each symbol on the purple spider card will give you a letter.

The first letter is W (2U = Double U)

WIT

The Spider Code

To get the code, finish the five puzzles that go with the five spider cards you have.

To get the correct order, look carefully at the end of the letter from the spider and at the five cards.

The order of the spiders on the bottom of the letter and the spider on each card match. Place them in the correct order and use their puzzle solutions to complete the code.

398.8097wit

VFPL Brochure/Computer Password/ Green Spider Card

There are several underlined letters in the library brochure.

Write out all of the underlined letters to get a hidden message about the computer password.

If you try to use it to unlock the computer, you will notice it does not work. You will need to fix the password using the green spider card.

“Password blue boy rabbit”

Blue = Red
Boy = Head
Rabbit = 56088

Computer Unlock

You will need the VFPL brochure and green spider card to get the password. There are several underlined letters in the library brochure.

Write out all of the underlined letters to get a hidden message about the computer password.

If you try to use it to unlock the computer you will notice it does not work. You will need to fix the password using the green spider card.

redhead56088

Late, Return, Lost

Use the updated Return Policy with the library index card.

Start at the front desk.

Use the directions you get to end up in a particular section of the library.

From the front desk: Up, Up, Right, Down, Right, Up, Right, Down, Down. This leads to the reference section.

Searching The Library

Use the updated Return Policy with the library index card.

Start at the front desk.

Use the directions you get to end up in a particular section of the library.

reference

Door Unlock/Bookshelf

You will need to have unlocked the “Searching the Library” QR code. Some of the books on the shelves seem to be out of place.

Use the letters from each book that are out of place to get the hidden message.

The message should start with “the code...”

2517

Cataloging Drawers/ Brown Spider Card

If you count the number of drawers, you get eight across and seven up and down. What else has that number?

The letter grid on the brown spider card matches the number of drawers.

Use the open drawers to get a hidden message. The message should start with “Not…”

“Not the pages”

Travel Poster and Globe

You have a poster of World Tours and a globe.

Use each grouping of countries from the poster and trace out the path they make.

You should get a number for each group so that you get four numbers in total.

5702

Safe Unlock

You will need to solve the globe puzzle to unlock the safe.

Use each grouping of countries from the poster and trace out the path they make.

You should get a number for each group so that you get four numbers in total.

5702

Spiders in Safe/Locked Drawer

You need to have the safe unlocked first. You have five lines of spiders and five tumblers for the locked drawer.

The spiders in the safe have arrows on them. Some point up and some point down. Use the image of the drawer lock as a starting point. Then move according to what each spider shows.

Example: The first number on the lock is 1 and the first line of spiders have 2 arrows pointing up, so the number you would get is Note: Once you unlock the drawer there is something you need to do with what you see inside.

34652

Spider Web and Coin

You have a spider web with letters, where else have you seen a spider web that looks like that one? The spider web on the coin is similar to the spider web of letters, but there is something that stands out about the web on the coin.

Some of the web strands on the coin are thicker than the others. Use those strands to get the letters you need.

One of the words you will get is “Author”

Author is John Glass”

Orange Spider Card and Torn Page

The text on the torn page and the text from the spider card should be read carefully. The text is almost identical.

Find the differences and use them to get a message.

This puzzle will tell you the book title needed to translate the hidden journal.

“Secrets in the Dark by author”

Decoding The Journal

You need to solve the torn page puzzle and spider web puzzle first. The text on the torn page and the text from the spider card should be read carefully.

The text is almost identical. Find the differences and use them to get a message.

This puzzle will tell you the book title needed to translate the hidden journal. Solve the spider web to get the author's name.

secretsglass

Final Solution

jillianhill

Death At The Lamplight Theatre

3 Photos Of Letters Arranged in a Circle

Secret Santa Rules


From Santa’s little Helper Envelope:

Painted Letters

Elves With Presents

The 12 Days Of Christmas

Naughty & Nice RSVP list

Shelves With Christmas Ornaments

Merry Christmas From The Helper

Christmas Tree


Suspect Cards:

Hannah Johnson

Nicholas Collins

Joanna Adams

Bethany Martin

Mark Phillips

Rachel Williams

Timothy Butler


Photos Of Rings Of Letters

On the note from The Helper, you will notice that he mentions three different shapes and a snowflake. Take a close look at the three Polaroid photos with the rings of letters surrounding a triangle, circle, and star. Using the notes from The Helper, lay the snowflake across the Polaroids to get the correct letters that you need to get the hidden message.

Note that on each ring of letters there is an underlined letter, this is the start point for each photo. If you lay the snowflake across the photo with the top of the snowflake (where the hole is) pointing north it will cover six of the letters. Use the letters that remain, starting with the underlined letter

You should get the letters “I T I S N O” The message you get will help you eliminate a suspect

“It is not Bob Cratchit.”

This eliminates Timothy Butler.

Victor’s Dressing Room Door

On Victor’s dressing room door, it reads “Which list…” What item in the box could this be referring to? Notice the “Naughty and Nice List” has all the names of the cast and crew members and the door also lists different groupings of cast and crew members.

There is a hint on the door that mentions the word trace. How could you use this hint with the “Naughty and Nice List”? Trace the names on the “Naughty and Nice List” that you find on the door. Think of it as connecting the dots.

You will be creating four numbers when you trace the names. This will unlock Victor’s dressing room door

6352

Message On The Mirror In Victor’s Dressing Room

Need to have Victor’s dressing room door unlocked. The symbols drawn on the mirror in Victor’s dressing room should remind you of something else that relates to Christmas. Match the symbols on the mirror to the 12 days of Christmas.

You should have two simple math problems that will help you complete the message. The first math problem you get should be 12, divided by 4, then minus 2. The second math problem you get should be 1, plus 3 plus 7, then minus 8.

This message will help you eliminate a person if you look carefully through the “A Christmas Carol” cast list

“Not the one with three faces.”

This eliminates Mark Phillips since he is the only actor with three roles.

Painted Letters

You found some letters painted in various colors. Where else have you seen all of those colors? On the note left from The Helper, notice the row of different colors across the bottom.

Using the order of the colored lines from The Helper’s note, fill in the painted letters to get a message. (Black = space) The message should start with “The murderer…”

This message will help you eliminate a suspect after you’ve completed the secret Santa puzzle

“The murderer is not Victor’s Secret Santa.”

Secret Santa

Need to have Victor’s dressing room door unlocked

Use Chloe Davis’ interview with the gift tag from Victor’s room.

Focus on filling in the Secret Santa list using the ones that you know for sure based on the interview with Chloe and the gift tag found in Victor’s dressing room. Once you have done that, filling in the rest should be a little bit easier.

Victor -> Rachel

Rachel -> Timothy

Timothy -> Joanna

Joanna -> Bethany

Bethany -> Mark

Mark -> Hannah

Hannah -> Nicholas

Nicholas-> Victor

Unlocking Abigail Wilson Information

Need to have Victor’s dressing room door unlocked first.

You will need to finish the Secret Santa puzzle to get what you need to unlock Abigail’s information. Use Chloe Davis’ interview, with the gift tag from Victor’s room, to fill in the names of who is who’s Secret Santa

Focus on filling in the Secret Santa list using the ones that you know for sure based on the interview with Chloe and the gift tag found in Victor’s dressing room. Once you have done that filling in the rest should be a little bit easier

vrtjbmhn

Storage Case/Christmas Shelves

Need to unlock Abigail Wilson information first. Abigail mentions that to get the case open will take a little bit of math. She also gives you the order needed for the numbers.

To get the numbers look at the Christmas decorations on the shelves. The numbers at the end of each row and at the top of each column represent the total value of each row and column.

If you are having trouble with the puzzle, try focusing on the bottom row and second column.

3411

Car And Car Key

The keys you find in the storage case have a message on them along with several letters. How many letters come between each set of letters?

The numbers you get here will help you unlock the car. Once the car is unlocked you should find something that will help you eliminate a suspect.

Make sure you remember who the key belongs to in order to know which suspect to eliminate.

456211

Christmas Tree Lights And Card

Need to have the storage case unlocked.

You have two things that relate to a Christmas tree. Pair them up and see what you get. Use the Christmas card with the blinking lights video

The letters you get from this will spell out a message that will help you eliminate a suspect after you have gotten the storage case opened. The message should start with. “Not the…”

“Not the writer of the love note.”

Joanna’s Playlist/Song List from Abigail And Notes From Soundbooth

Need to have Abigail’s information unlocked. In the soundbooth, you found a few different things, one of which was “Joanna's playlist.” It would not play properly and kept skipping at certain times. Pair this with the information that Abigail gives you.

Pay special attention to the note from The Helper that was found in the sound booth. It is a hint on how to work this puzzle. “I can’t get the lines and words …”

Use the minute marker as the number of the song in the list Abigail gives you and the second marker as the word in the song title. The message should start with “Hark is…"

“Hark is first, cold comes after hark, last is night.”

Brick Wall and Presents

Need to have Abigail’s information unlocked. You will need to have solved the first part of this puzzle which is Joanna’s playlist.

In the soundbooth, you found a wall that was crumbling and had words written on the bricks. Pair this with the message he leaves about the presents and you will notice that the numbers in each row and column for the bricks and presents match

Using the words you got from the song, which should be three words, match them up to the bricks and then match them up to the presents. This should help you eliminate a suspect.

Hark = Killer

Cold = Is Not

Night = Joanna

Christmas Decoration Shelves

Find the value of each decoration.

The numbers above and to the side tell you the sum of each row and column.

Nutcracker = 1

Christmas Tree = 3

Snowman = 4

Santa = 7

Where Is The Helper

You will need to have eliminated all but one suspect to do this puzzle.

3235

Final Solution

Eliminate all suspects and get the motive from the “Where is the Helper?” unlock

martinlove

Museum Nocturnus

Lisa Card
