Determining Which Suspect is Which

This involves unlocking the computer which has been locked by a virus. The fax from FLUK3 holds the key to opening the computer. Each letter of the alphabet at the bottom of the fax is represented by a series of 5 characters (* and B)

The letters in the message from FLUK3 are underlined in groups of 5. Some of them are in bold print. The * represents characters in the message that aren’t in bold and the B represents characters in the message that are in bold. Take each underlined group of numbers, determine the pattern of * and B that make up that grouping of letters, and match it up to the appropriate letter below

Example: ABCDE would be represented in the alphabet by ****B because the first four characters aren’t bold and the fifth is. When we look at the alphabet supplied by FLUK3 that would give you the letter B. Apply this approach to each grouping of underlined letters until you have the passcode to bypass the computer virus. Once you have done this, you will know which suspect matches up with which photo.

vfpdsux

Finding Reggie Duncan’s Blog

Reggie has some important information for you that will help you determine what is going on and tells you to visit his blog. At the bottom of his interview card, he gives you a coded link that will lead to his blog.

Right before he gives you the encoded blog link, he provides a hint when he says, “But I can’t be the only one left. See what I did there?” What this means is to take each letter of the coded link and shift one letter or number to the left.

Example: The letter C would become B, B would become A, and so on. Once you have the correct link to Reggie’s blog, he gives you the key to getting Katy to talk to you. He also provides one of the criteria for how the suspects have been chosen (one thing they all have in common).

https://kidcrypto213.wixsite.com/mysite

Katy’s Bracelet:

Deciphering Katy’s bracelet is the key to getting her to talk to you. The message on Katy’s bracelet at first glance may look like some sort of substitution code. It isn’t.

What’s written there is more of a rebus than a code (think about the way license plate messages are written). Each part of the message provides a certain sound. When combined, these sounds will form a common saying

For instance X would become Ex. Once you have figured out the message and are able to gain information from Katy she gives you information that is used to help eliminate a suspect.

excuseme

Secret Message in Song

Katy says she can confidently eliminate one of the suspects because of a tattoo on his arm that matches a hidden name in verse two of the Red Fang song.

The tabloid article contains the entire song

Take the first letter of each line of the second verse and use the name you gain to eliminate a suspect based on Katy’s interview.

cora

CSI Puzzle

The CSI in this case has information that should help eliminate a suspect. The only problem is she gives you a test that will help you access her briefcase. This puzzle is simple in theory but a bit tougher to execute: simply count the number of triangles.

Obviously, you begin by counting the small triangles. Then, from there, count all the larger triangles inside the shape. The total number you end up with is followed by a zero and then used twice. The combination you should end up with should be in this format: _ _ 0 _ _ 0

Once you have the correct answer you can open the briefcase and gain access to a list of some of the suspect’s tattoos. On the interview sheet, Nick tells you something about the killer’s tattoo that you can use in conjunction with the tattoo sheet you obtain from the briefcase to eliminate a suspect.

the puzzle contains 27 triangles and the briefcase unlock is 270270

First Puzzle on Leads Sheet

This puzzle is used to gain access to Murray Chemical. Fogerty Reynolds thanks Katy for teaching him to write this way. Think about the way the bracelet was decoded and a similar method applies to the message written on the back of the Leads sheet.

Look at each line and try to understand what it means. The translation should fit perfectly into the blanks on the other side of the Leads sheet. Those blanks marked with a red X are the ones you will use to gain access to the chemical company.

Example: Line 1 reads STAND which translates into I understand.

I

Use what you obtain from the red X’s to unlock the chemical company.

waste

DeGarmo Dental Labs

You are directed to tell Sharlene at DeGarmo Dental what kind of food you’ve discovered and she will provide some helpful information.

Examine the photo of what you find inside the chemical company and provide the correct answer to get Sharlene to talk.

duck

Creature Features Studios

When you talk to Sharelene at DeGarmo Dental she mentions Creature Features Makeup Studios, the City Council motto, a game, and she provides a series of numbers. You will gain access to Creature Features by using the City Council motto, the Bingo card, and the numbers.

The letters in the City Council motto match up perfectly with the Bingo card numbers (5x5) Find each number that Sharlene gives you on the Bingo card and match it up to the letter in the same position in the City Council logo.

Use what you obtain to unlock the Creature Features card. What you learn not only gives you a lot of information about what’s really been going on but also provides information that eliminates a suspect.

ruse

Locked Box Under Willow Tree

Before he was killed, Fogerty Reynolds made a final paranoid post on social media. He mentions burying some information in a lock box under a willow tree near the pond inside Easthaven Forest. He tells you Nietzsche contains the key to unlocking the box

Find the card with Nietzsche and use all of the capital letters that are not supposed to be capitalized to unlock the box.

murray

SD Card

The last entry on the Leads sheet tells you that the key to reading the SD card can be found in the locked box beneath the willow tree. Once you’ve unlocked the box (using the Nietzsche clue) you will find 4 sets of numbers

Each set of numbers contains a pattern of sorts that you must figure out to accurately predict the next number in the series. There are 4 patterns to figure out (one for each line). Determine the next number in each series and use the entire number you obtain (next numbers in each series placed side by side) to open the SD card.

Pattern 1: double the number plus 1, Pattern 2: times 3, times 4, times 5, etc, Pattern 3: plus 2, plus 3, plus 4, etc, Pattern 4: multiply by two and subtract 1. The contents of the SD card give you information about each of the victims including the date of their death. Cross-check the dates of death against the dates that each suspect was incarcerated. You should find that one suspect was incapable of committing the crimes because they were in jail at the time.

953602265

Which Suspect Killer Fogerty Reynolds?

At this point, having completed all the above puzzles, you should have the information needed to unlock this.

Use the killer’s first name and the reference number from the suspect card to unlock.

david48296

Final Solution

In order to solve the box, the directions instruct you to use the first initial of each person implicated in the case in the order they are mentioned by the killer.

When you answer “Who Killed Fogerty Reynolds?” the killer gives you a list of five people who were implicated in the plot. Use the first initial of each name in order.

Unlock the box’s final solution.

mrmcd

Snakes and Ladders

A crumpled up note was found at the feet of the victims. Smooth out the note and read what is on the back of the office memo.

The note mentions climbing the corporate ladder. Start at the bottom of the snakes and ladders puzzle and work your way upward, using the order of the colors mentioned in the note (red, green, blue). Read all letters in red first from bottom to top. Read all letters in green second from bottom to top. Read all letters in blue from bottom to top.

Use and interpret what you decode to eliminate a group of people based on their +1 status. Depending on what order you have solved the puzzles this will eliminate up to 15 suspects.

I exist alone but I live for the king’s entertainment.Use this to eliminate everyone who is coming to the party with a +1

The Fool

This card has several scrambled words at the bottom.

Unscramble them

Put the words in an order that makes sense. Notice there is a chess board on the card,match the message with the larger chess board. Notice that all of the people are said to be part of the king’s court i.e. royalty.Depending on what order you have solved the puzzles this will eliminate up to 8 suspects.

plenty of royalty here but no jester

You should have a chessboard flyer from King’s Court Technology with several people’s photographs. You can use the solution from The Fool message to eliminate these as suspects.

Jester Cap/Numbers and Letters

This document is filled with rows of numbers and letters and has a jester’s cap in the background.

The back contains a message that says: “The things I would do for the king are without number.”Remove all numbers from the columns and use only the letters.

If you have trouble telling the Os and zeros apart then then treat them like Os and remove them at the end if the don't make sense. The message will start with “I always ...” Depending on what order you have solved the puzzles this will eliminate up to 16 suspects.

I always make sure the table where I sit I’m fully surrounded by people that I trust. If there are gaps that creates weakness and if I can’t trust you then you are literally dead to me.

Use the seating chart to determine which tables have empty seats. Eliminate those people at tables with empty seats.

Waiter Interview

In one of the interviews, someone mentions that the waiter speaks in pig latin when drunk.

The interview is transcribed exactly as the waiter spoke it (in pig latin). The rules used by Pig Latin are as follows:

If a word begins with a vowel, just as "yay" to the end. For example, "out" is translated into "outyay".

If it begins with a consonant, then we take all consonants before the first vowel and we put them on the end of the word. For example, "which" is translated into "ichwhay". Use the rules to understand what the waiter is saying.

You should be able to eliminate a suspect with this info.

I have a bad habit of speaking in pig latin when i’m drunk. Someone spiked my water bottle. I think the reason they did it is because they needed my badge. It accesses the service elevator. I lost it a couple of hours ago. I wasn’t even really paying attention. I was too busy trying to get the phone number of the lady with glasses who works in customer service. Not the one with three names. She has spent all night on the dance floor. By the way the elevator code is found on my badge. It is one to one.

This eliminates the lady with glasses who works in customer service who was on the dance floor all night. It also provides you with the password for the elevator which are the numbers between the ones on the waiter’s badge.

Opening the Elevator

In his interview, the waiter tells you that the elevator code is on his badge.

The last sentence of the interview tells you the two numbers on the badge that are significant.

Use the numbers that are between the numbers the waiter mentions to unlock the elevator.

8792

Unlocking the Safe

The safe has a rotary dial and a key lock which means you are looking for 3 numbers and a key to open it

When you unlock the elevator you find a key. The key has three rules written on the key tag. You are asked for the year of the company’s founding. Search Simon Bank’s Facebook page for the answer to this

Use the year you find to answer the other two questions. Find the numbers using the directions on the key tag first. The Jester photocopy contains one final adjustment to the numbers you have obtained. Make sure you have got the numbers using the key tag first before you apply the adjustments. Use all three numbers together to unlock the safe

1145

Unlocking the Phone

Read the interview of the woman who covers her face to hide her identity

She gives you the method to unlock her phone in her interview.

Find the word in the King’s Court Technology Handbook that she refers to and use it to unlock the phone. The cover does not count as page 1. The info you find will help you to eliminate a suspect.

voila

Using the Keypad that Unlocks the Storage Room

Examine the janitor’s cart and read his note.

Fill in the blanks using the names of King’s Court executives.

Take the letters that are circled and use them on the keypad. Make sure to convert each letter to its proper number using the keypad for reference. What you find will help you eliminate up to two suspects.

434687

Places to Take Note of When Eliminating Suspects

Snakes and ladders solution, The chessboard puzzle,Numbers and letters/jester’s hat solution, Unlocked phone contents, The waiter’s interview, Those who aren’t on the guest list at all, and What you find in the storage room.

Special note: Some suspects may be eliminated more than once.

Matt, Adam, and Laine are dead so they obviously are eliminated as suspects.

Nathan and MarthaLynn can be eliminated since they did not attend the party.

The following are eliminated due to them having a plus one on the guest list: Nacy, Matt, Peter, Laine, Brett, Mary Alice, LeeAnn, Brandi, Tobias, Mollye, Myra, Michael,Adam, Whitney, and Trai.

The Jester states that he/she is not royalty, this eliminates all of the executives as suspects since they are all part of “the King’s Court” as shown by the chessboard promotional poster

The following are eliminated due to the table they are at having an empty seat or having someone untrustworthy at the table: Mary Alice, Cher, Tobias, Nancy, Brayden, Matt, Trai, LeeAnn, Candace, Whitney, Adam, Laine, Mollye, Peter, Kiera, and Mary Ann.

Michael and Amy are eliminated by what is found in the storage room.

Crystal is eliminated as a suspect by the waiter’s interview.

Stephanie is eliminated by what is found on the phone.

Shredded Document

Treat this as a literal puzzle and arrange the strips in a way that recreates the original document.

Refer back to the file folder you found when you unlocked the safe. The subject line of the shredded document tells you to take lines 2 and 4 of the key together and then flip end to end. So instead of M being under the A, M is now under the Z.

They are using the Company Code but they have reversed it so it is backwards. Once you have done that, use it to translate the alphabet and decode the message on the shredded document. The first part of Laine’s message reads “I have a …” Pay special attention to what you’ve learned. Part of the final solution is found here. ****Note-if you want to see the completed image without any shredding scroll down to the next page of this document.

The subject line says to string lines 2 and 4 of key together then flip end toend.

Lines 2 and 4 together would be: monlightabcdefjkpqrsuvwxyz

Flipped end to end that would be: zyxwvusrqpkjfedcbathgilnom

Use that to decode the alphabet:
zyxwvusrqpkjfedcbathgilnom
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz

So z=a, y=b, and so forth until you get to the end where m=z

This will give you what you need to decipher the shredded note’s contents.

Here is what the note should read once decoded:

I have a buyer. Benjamin Franklin is walking into the bank. Do you follow?

Without question.

Absolutely.

Great. Artemis at BVI is ready to pay up.

Image
Final Solution

The shredded document gives you part of the solution once you’ve decoded the message it contained originally. Determining who The Jester is gives you the other part of the solution

Use both pieces of information to unlock the box solution.

franklincampos

The Dark and Stormy Night
Content List

The Dark and Stormy Night Contents List

Half Sheets

Beginning Brief

Table Photo with Numbered Chairs

Hangman

What Happened 2 Years Ago

Transcript

Library Shelf with 9 Books

Book Cover - The Strange and Winding Road

Sherlock Holmes sheet


4x6 cards

7 Crime Cards (hacker, forger, spy, money launderer, safecracker, art thief, cat burglar)

7 Suspect Cards (Pierre Gaston, Jayme Worrell, Carlton Bertram, Benjamin Baker, Herb Kelso,Alex Rossi, Carly La Rue)

Gramophone/Phonograph “Play to Bring …”

Bust of Mozart

Painting of Fruit/Still Life

Solution Card


Miscellaneous

Collectible Card

Will Street Business Card

Bookmark


Unlocking the Library (Row of 9 books)

Listen to the gramophone recording.

Find the words in the recording that appear on some of the books

Determine the numbers of those books. Use the recording to determine the sequence of the numbers and use those to unlock the QR code.

25194

(use the info from the audio file you get from scanning the gramophone and the book titles)

Mozart Bust Unlock

You must complete the seating chart and have all the suspects matched to their characters to unlock the Mozart bust.

68324

(found from the bookshelf unlock and the completed seating chart)

Fruit Picture Unlock

You need to solve all 7 of the book covers in order to unlock

neaneed

(Obtained from completing all 7 book cover puzzles)

Seating Chart Puzzle

Use what you unlock in the library to determine who is sitting at what seat at the table.

Make sure to seat the art thief in the blue chair.

1. Rosemary Clark

2. Alex Rossi

3. Benjamin Baker

4. Pierre Gaston

5. Carlton Bertram

6. Carly La Rue

7. Herb Kelso

8. Jayme Worrell


(You need to have all of the suspects matched to the characters first. Then use the info from the book shelf unlock)

Matching Suspects to Crimes Puzzle

Rosemary lists a specific group of guests at the bottom of the seating chart directions that should be used to gain access to Mozart’s secret. Once you have determined which type of criminal corresponds to each seat you need to determine which suspect goes with which crime

Use the excerpts from “The Dark and Stormy Night” off of the back of each crime card to give you hints about which suspect it should be matched up with.

The bookmark can also offer some assistance in linking two of the suspects with their crimes. (Chives are among the most dangerous herbs for cats. The French word for street is Rue.) Things to take note of in each description:

Hacker: excerpt mentions smoke and stroking his beard (who matches this description)

Spy: “A skilled spy is a master at waiting on others.” (which character waits on others)

Forger: “A baker and a forger of handwriting have a lot in common.” (Any bakers in the group?”

Cat Burglar: excerpt talks about a cat burglar that is no longer in his prime (also see bookmark)

Safecracker: the mention of St. Charles Street and a very good sense of hearing (also from bookmark...The French word for street is Rue.)

The Art Thief: enjoys all things French (anyone have a French name)

The Money Launderer: description mentions making things clean (which suspect makes things clean). Once you have the suspect matched with the crime, enter the seat numbers in the order of the suspects Rosemary mentions to gain access to the secret Mozart is hiding. This information is to confirm you have the right people matched to the right characters and to provide more background on each character

1. Hacker-Alex Rossi (fast hands, smoke, and beard)

2. Forger-Benjamin Baker (Baker and baker)

3. Art Thief-Pierre Gaston (French)

4. Spy-Carlton Bertram (Waiting on others/butler)

5. Safecracker-Carly La Rue (Nimble hands)

6. Cat Burglar-Herb Kelso (old, less graceful, faded eyesight= old, bad leg, glasses)

7. Money Launderer-Jayme Worrell (Laundering =Cleaning = Maid)


(Use the info from the character cards and info about the suspects to match to the characters to the correct suspects)

The Hot and Smoking Gun Puzzle

The clue on this book cover is: Author of “The Hangman’s Tale.”

Find the game of hangman and use the group of letters on the book cover to fill in the blanks.

They go into the blanks in the order they are in

paolo’s signature not a forgery

The Strange and Winding Road Puzzle

The clue here is: Author of “The First Shall Be Last.”

In this case, that clue means A=Z, B=Y, etc.

Write out the entire alphabet in this way and use the result to decode the message.

number seven was in the hospital when painting was stolen

The Wrong and Evil Path Puzzle

The clue here is: Author of “The Numbers are What Matter.”

Convert the alphabet to letters using A=1, B=2, etc.

Take the numeric value of each letter and use those numbers to solve the math. Convert the resulting numbers back to letters

not art thief

The Odd and Dreary Dark Puzzle

The clue here is: Author of “Merge.”

You will notice a string of vowels under the Coral Readers quote and a row of consonants at the bottom of the cover

. Merge the two lines to make a coherent message.

no evidence of hacking

The Bitter and Brutal Truth Puzzle

The clue here is: Author of “Murder Among the Stacks.”

Take the two rows of letters and stack one on top of the other

Read from top to bottom, left to right. The first word you should get is “Staff”.

staff were at winterwood on twelve five (12/5)

The Long and Cold Winter Puzzle

Read the message on the side of the cover backwards.

the painting was safe inside the safe

The Dark and Stormy Night Puzzle

The clue here is: Author of “Vacant Eyes”

In the center of the book cover are several lines of letters. Immediately following the first letter ‘L’ there is an extra ‘i’ occurring every other letter. Remove all of those extra ‘i’s and read what’s left.

Follow the directions that remain and use what you obtain (and have obtained from the other 6 book covers) to gain access to the secret behind the fruit painting. Make sure to put the books in the order they occur in the series

look behind fruit and use the tenth letter of each puzzle solution to open

Accessing Email Unlock

The hint says to use the nickname of the only person in the group Rosemary is sure is no longer a criminal.

She tells you the answer in her seating chart instructions.

Use the nickname descriptions found at the Mozart unlock.

johnhancock


(use info from the Mozart unlock and from the seating chart instructions)

Computer Login Unlock

The unlock asks you to use the name of the operation.

The answer is found in the email.

Use the necessary word to unlock the computer.

unmask


(obtained from the email unlock)

Sherlock Unlock

The computer unlock references Sherlock.

Take the four groupings of room routes and use them on the back of the computer unlock.

Notice how each room mentioned matches with one of the 9 symbols.Trace your route and see what you have made. Each route throughout the house should provide a number. Find all 4 numbers by going in order through the rooms mentioned in each list. Example: Library, Kitchen, Bedroom, Music room, Sitting room, Dining room would make a 4 since you have a path through the rooms looking like this

Unlock Sherlock.

7102


(obtained from Login: Operation Nickname unlock and the diagram on the back side of the Login: Operation Nickname paper)

Final Solution

The final unlock asks you for Montecristo Number ? (refer to the fruit bowl painting unlock and read carefully)

The final unlock also asks you for the first name of the killer and the first name of the mastermind. Both of these can be obtained through deduction after unlocking the Sherlock art.

The killer’s name can also be determined from reading through the fruit bowl unlock as well and matching some of the information up with the person you determined to be the cat burglar. The mastermind’s name can be determined after reading the post it note tacked to the benefit poster (Sherlock QR).

onesherbjayme

The Collector

Gaining Access to the Junkyard Unlock

Read the numbered letter from The Collector.

The note mentions a nightclub.

Examine the nightclub wristband and focus on the ‘over 21’ part. Find the sheet that looks like cardboard that has numbers and letters on it. Pick out all the ones that are over 21 and use the resulting password to gain access to the junkyard. Take note of what’s in the reveal. You will need it later.

vangogh

Gaining Access to the Train Unlock

Look at the numbered letter from The Collector and focus on number 2.

“If ever there was a place to Hideaway…”

Find the note from The Hideaway Motel. Do the math to determine the correct number of inches. Notice the four symbols on the side of the note. Use the Letter from Lorrie (grey sheet with words and symbols over certain characters) to determine what each symbol translates into. Examine the Quarantine paper. Each of the symbols you translated corresponds to a line and represents the starting point for that line. Four symbols correspond to four lines. Using the ruler, start at the letter and move over the correct number of inches (obtained from the math you did in step 4). Unlock the train and take note of what you find.It will be used later.

ahab

(Use Hideaway note, ruler and yellow paper)

Gaining Access to the Truck Unlock

Examine part number three from The Collector’s notes

There are a series of numbers listed below.Find the dirty paper with circles and numbers.

Use the numbers The Collector provides and connect the dots to form letters. Use the word you obtain to unlock the truck. Take note of what you find. You will need this later

hook

(Use the paper with the colored circles and numbers with the list of numbers given at the end of the collectors notes)

Collector’s Note Puzzle

You have a strange sheet of characters that The Collector left behind in the box in the mini storage.

Use the Letter From Lorrie (grey sheet with strange symbols over some of the characters) to decode the alphabet

Use the Letter From Lorrie (grey sheet with strange symbols over some of the characters) to decode the alphabet

A bad person I am not

I’ve had bad things done to me

Hawthorne you need

To visit the library

(Use the gray note from Lorrie to help with translating)

Public Library Unlock

When decoding The Collector’s message, you are given the word that you need

Use it to access the library.

hawthorne

(Obtained from the translation of the note with the weird symbols)

Gaining Access to the Foreclosed Home Unlock

Gaining Access to the Foreclosed Home Unlock

Focus on the part that says “Spell that with which you speak.” Take note of the title of the book where you found that clue

Locate the Greek circle puzzle that features The Scarlet Letter. Compare it to the second Greek circle puzzle (this one has more blood on it). “Spell that with which you speak” on the circle with the Scarlet A. Match those letters up to the ones in the same position on the second circle and obtain the password that will unlock the foreclosed home. Hint: What do we use to speak? (5 letter word). Take note of what you find here. It will be used later.

apate

(Uses a hint you get from unlocking the library and the two papers with letter circles around a Roman figure)

Miami Postcard Puzzle Unlock

The objective of this puzzle is to determine the pattern of the symbols

To find this, decode each symbol and find the corresponding letter. Determine how many spaces are between each letter in the sequence and use that information to figure out what the missing letter is.

Convert the letters back into symbols. You will use this after you have found 4 bodies.

First blank – Symbol for W, Second blank – Symbol for B, Third blank – Symbol for R, Fourth Blank – Symbol for Y bodies.

Storage Unit 15 Unlock

Notice that on the Will Street FB Page there is a list detailing who rented each storage unit. Storage Unit 15 is rented by Mia Adirolf. When you look at this you can see that Adirolf is Florida spelled backwards and Mia is short for Miami.This connects the Miami postcard with storage unit #15.

As you unlock different locations you find some of The Collector’s alphabet symbols in addition to extra symbols with plus and minus. These extra symbols connect with the potential victim cards to show you which victim that you just located. The alphabet symbols match up with the symbols that you solved for on the Miami postcard.

If you also notice that each victim’s card has a number on it – it might be an id number or a street address. Now, you need to put the victims in the correct order according to the symbol found at their location and according to the order given to you on the Miami postcard. Once you have the correct order, solve the equation using the numbers from the victim cards and you will have code to access storage unit #15. The number you end up with is three digits.

396

Final Solution

When you unlock Storage Unit 15 there are more of The Collector alphabet symbols that have been left. The flame symbol you should have seen somewhere else before.

You will also notice a flame that matches the flame on the cat birthday card.

Decode the symbols at the bottom. Notice which letters are marked out on the cat birthday card and mark those letters out from the symbols that you just decoded and see what you are left with.

prometheus

Eliminating a Suspect

Pay close attention to the The Wandering Monster Parade commercial

Pay close attention to the time of death as stated in the beginning brief.

In the commercial one of the performers has a show at the time of the murder and thus cannot be the killer,

Ms. Cthulhu

In one of his hints to you, Howie talks about Cthulhu and typewriters with QWERTY key arrangements.

You have a picture of a typewriter in your box.

He talks about “being put on the right track.” Take each letter from the puzzle, find it on the typewriter and move right one key. Write down your results.

to buy tickets use johns moniker

(Use Ms. Cthulhu page, typewriter page, and info from Howies interview)

Comic Strip Puzzle

You will notice that each portion of the comic is in its own column with a specific image at the bottom.

Read the last thing Howie mentions in his interview very carefully. Notice how certain words correspond to certain images on the comic strip.

Use what Howie tells you to rearrange the order of the columns. Write the columns of letters down in the correct order and read left to right. This will eliminate a suspect

Wolfie did a public appearance at zoo at time of queens death

(use comic strip with info in Howie’s interview)

Spiders

Notice that there are 9 rows of spiders with 5 spiders in each row

Lux tells you: "Black Widow Venom Could Cause Aches, Pains, Agony, Death." This contains 9 words with 5 letters each.

Ariana, The Spider Queen, gives you 9 colors. Match each word that Lux tells you with each color Ariana provides (example: the first word is Black, the first color is green...so the word Black goes with the color green). Once you have the color that corresponds to each word, rearrange the words so that they go with their appropriate colors (example: since we know the word Black goes with the color green, we can place the word Black on the row with the green spiders.) Place each word according to the color it corresponds with. Take the letters that are circled and read from top to bottom. If you still are having trouble with getting the words matched with the correct colored spiders, here is what it should look like


P A I N S

C O U L D

D E A T H

C A U S E

B L A C K

V E N O M

W I D O W

A G O N Y

A C H E S

not clowns

(Use the spider page, quote from Lux, and colors given by Ariana)

Coffin

Wolfgang tells you how to unlock the coffin inside Scarlett’s trailer

The Homecoming King’s interview is a good place to look for the answer.

nosferatu

(Gained from Wolfgang’s interview and Brady Franklin’s interview)

Mirror Maze

Read John Harrell’s interview to determine what you need to gain access.

Read the interview with Chatters the Clown to find the password.

1989

(Info found in John Harrell’s interview and Chatters interview)

Concessions

You will need to have unlocked the Mirror Maze first.

Read Lux’s interview to determine how to gain access to the Concession Stand.

The name you need is found in the newspaper clipping you found in the Mirror Maze.

mills

(info found from Lux interview and the paper from the Mirror Maze unlock)

Ticket Booth

You will need to solve the Ms. Cthulhu puzzle and have opened the Mirror Maze and the Concession Stand before you can open this.

Use the instructions that you decoded from Ms. Cthulhu. Read Howie’s first hint completely. He gives a lot of information here.

Read Howie’s second hint which describes what a certain word refers to. Howie mentions that you will need two parts. Consult what you discovered inside the Mirror Maze to find that portion of the password. Examine what you found in the Concessions booth. Put both components of the password together to open the ticket booth (no caps, no spaces).

feral038

(Info found in Howie’s interview, the Ms. Cthulhu puzzle, the ID found in the concession stand, and paper found in the Mirror Maze)

Crazy Circus/Insane Clowns

Notice that certain letters are blacked out. Use all the black letters. Write those all together

After gaining access to the ticket booth, you are instructed to use what we buried in the clown art along with another piece of specific information.

Follow the instructions.

when used with Ticket Booth info): crazynewsfreak@valleyfallsobserver.com

STALK Report

The email gives a very specific set of instructions for how to unlock the STALK report. At this point, you should have eliminated 6 suspects

Take the number of each suspect that you have eliminated and put the numbers in sequence.

Use the sequence of numbers to unlock the report.

234567

(info in email provides the unlock)

STALK/Mikey

To learn what sort of information Mikey has, use the special password you obtained from the STALK report.

fangs

(Word provided in the STALK file)

Final Solution

After reviewing what Mikey discovered, you should have the first and last name of the killer.

scarlettkilgore

The Traitor

Accessing the Safe

The message in a bottle says to use the journal entries about mythical creatures.

Consult Armstead’s journal and find the number in each journal entry associated with each mythical creature

Use those numbers in the order they appear to unlock the safe behind the portrait

2384

Puzzle Found in the Safe

You are looking for a pattern in the numbers that will help determine what the value of the missing space should be

Analyze each row of numbers and see if you can manipulate the first two numbers to obtain the third number.

Multiply the first and second numbers in each row. Then, subtract the first number to get the third number. The solution to this puzzle is a room number.

36 (gained by multiplying 4x10 and subtracting 4)

Kraken Casino

Use the loose playing card with this and determine what the name of your hand is.

Consult the Will Street Notes for help.

blackjack

Sea Dragon Lounge/Pirate Skeleton

Use the conversion chart gained from the Kraken Casino and the conversion chart in Captain Armstead’s journal to find the value for each commodity listed (silk, salt, rice, tobacco)

You are looking for a 4 digit code

Silk = 5

5867

Siren/Mermaid

Use the trade route directions in Captain Armstead’s journal to find three locations on the map (take note of their numbers). Follow the directions on the rum bottle label (gained from pirate skeleton unlock) to determine the three final numbers.

The ships all have a specific color and the colors mentioned on the rum bottle label will give you the order for the numbers. Then subtract one from each number.

Those numbers should correspond to a name on the ship’s crew manifest. Use the name of that sailor to unlock the file.

perryyoung

Leviathan/Circular Puzzle

Take the information from the Siren unlock and use it with the Leviathan Pool puzzle. Take the circular disc and find the symbol mentioned on the unlock (skull, parrot, key, anchor).

Use the underlined arrow to point to the number mentioned on the Siren unlock (ex: skull 1….the arrow with the line under it would point to the number 1). See what number the other arrow points to. Go in the order of the graphic until you have 4 numbers.

The skull points to 6

6802

Cryptex

Once you’ve solved the circle/Leviathan puzzle you will have what you need to solve the Cryptex. Notice that there is a line of letters marked by an arrow on each end. This is the starting point.

Use the directions gained from the Leviathan puzzle to manipulate each column of letters the appropriate number up or down. The letters need to stay in order as they are on the cryptex.

S __ __ __ N __ __ __ __ O __ __

714 (sevenonefour)

Anonymous Tip

You will need to complete the treasure hunt to unlock this.

The tipster will only reveal the secret information if you can answer the question. The answer can only be found at the end of the treasure hunt

Using the information found at the end of the treasure hunt (Cryptex unlock) determine the name of the location where the captain’s treasure was originally stolen from?

tortuga

Room Numbers (Day 1 & 2):

Look at the Case Notes/Interviews (Day One) to determine which rooms everyone started in.

Then use the Will Street Detective Agency Notes, and the room layout sheet to find out which rooms the suspects were in on day two.

36: Edward Davis

37: Sloane Smith

38: Matthew Ferguson

38: Matthew Ferguson

40: Alexander Gorman (victim)

40: Alexander Gorman (victim)

42: empty

43: Shanna Davis



(obtained through the Case Notes/Interviews (Day One))



Day 2:

36: Edward Davis

37: Empty

38: Sloane Smith

39: Matthew Ferguson

40: Alexander Gorman (victim)

41: Henry Kidd

42: Shanna Davis

43: Brian McGrath

Suspect Elimination Hints

Follow the hints in the message in the bottle to eliminate a suspect. The text message and the anonymous tip will eliminate a suspect.

Read what the bartender says in the case notes and figure out who is now in room 38 to eliminate a suspect. Figure out the message the steward is trying to give you.

The watch face gives a room number. Figure out who was the drunk at the Emerald Key Spa.

Final Solution

You will need to have eliminated all of the suspects and have the Anonymous Tip unlocked

davisbrutus

The Body Farm

Content List-2021 Version

The Body Farm Contents List:

Full Sheets:

Diary Entry (August 2, 1930) (double sided)

2nd diary entry “Alice has been studying …”
Palmistry poster
Spirit Board (S.T.A.L.K. document)(with letters,numbers, and shapes)

8x8 Square Sheet

House Blueprint
Map of The Hall

Half Sheets

Locked Phone
Gravedigger Note Nailed to Door
Corn drawing

4x6 Cards:

5 character cards
5 location cards (black and white): barn, silo, corn field, orchard, smokehouse
Family Photo
Solution Card

Miscellaneous:

Collectible Card
Museum Nocturnus Brochure

Note Nailed to the Door

Focus on the parts of the riddle that focus on the swan and the heavens. Examine the constellation chart.

Is there a constellation that is named after a swan. Consult the S.T.A.L.K. website mentioned on the brochure and visit The Body Farm section.

Examine the constellation pictures and find the constellation that is near the swan’s head. The swan constellation is called Cygnus. Use the name of that to unlock location 4 from the map.

Orchard can be unlocked by using the constellation named ‘lyra.’

(Use the note nailed to the door, the constellation map, and a constellation photo from the STALK website under the Body Farm section)

Phone Unlock

1. Note: Some google devices (specifically Pixel, Pixel 2) have trouble with this QR code. If this is you please use this link to access the file: https://img1.wsimg.com/blobby/go/73fe8e52-a6d9-4131-bdf8-58bb5bf71b3c/downloads/photo%20of%20buried%20hand-The%20Body%20Farm%20(1).pdf?ver=1564066352128

Examine the unlock hint on the phone and focus on the word ‘dummy.’

The number of question marks will tell you how many letters are in the unlock. Look in the Museum Nocturnus brochure for a dummy.

Use the name to unlock the phone.

woodrow

(You get this from the Museum Nocturnus brochure)

Buried Hand Riddle (from phone unlock)

The killer captions the photo of the buried hand with some words that appear elsewhere in the box. Consult Margaret’s communications in the automatic writing document to find out where to look for the link to these words. She mentions some of the interests she had and things she did out in the barn.

Use the numeric values given on the document associated with Margaret’s interest to obtain what you have left when “take away health.” This is a simple math problem that will yield a single-digit number. You should be looking at the Palmistry Chiromancy document.

Add the numerical values of reason, passion, intuition and fortune then subtract health. Locate the word that corresponds to that value and use it as the password to enter the barn.

Heart

(The math done using the words from the riddle and the Palmistry poster gives you the number 7. The word that corresponds to number 7 is heart. Heart is used to unlock the barn.)

Corn Drawing

Examine the drawing closely. Look for letters hidden in the drawing.

Find all the letters needed to spell a name. There are 12 letters hidden.

You should get a first and last name.

Travis Carter

Spirit Board (shape puzzle)

There are four shapes featured on the spirit board. Group the letters by the shape that surrounds them. Note: some letters are surrounded by multiple shapes, meaning that that letter is used multiple times (once for each shape)

Consult the brochure for information about the spirit board’s use in the S.T.A.L.K. investigation. Use the order of the shapes listed.

Unscramble each word. This will give you 4 words that will help you unlock one of the locations using a constellation name.

Silo unlock is “ursa”
(Use the spirit board and the shapes mentioned in the Museum Nocturnus brochure)

Blueprint

The S.T.A.L.K. team has a specific method that they use for rating the most haunted room in any house. Consult their notes to find that scale. Add up the values for each room based on the S.T.A.L.K. scale. Determine the most haunted house in the room.

Example: The kitchen is a 5, since E.V.P. is worth 2 and objects moving on their own is worth 3. Take the number of that room and use it to consult the Witch’s Sigil. Take the letter inside each triangle whose number corresponds to the number of the most haunted room in the Montgomery house and use that to unlock a specific place on the farm.

The word you get will once again be a constellation name. The S.T.A.L.K. team hints at which place in their notes about the Witch’s Sigil. Use the word you get to access the smokehouse.

Room #2 is the most haunted.
By following the number 2 on the Witch’s Sigil you obtain the constellation ‘draco’ which unlocks the smokehouse.

Barn Unlock

Solve the Buried hand puzzle to unlock. The killer captions the photo of the buried hand with some words that appear elsewhere in the box. Consult Margaret’s communications in the automatic writing document to find out where to look for the link to these words. She mentions some of the interests she had and things she did out in the barn.

Use the numeric values given on the document associated with Margaret’s interest to obtain what you have left when “take away health.” This is a simple math problem that will yield a single-digit number. You should be looking at the Palmistry Chiromancy document.

Add the numerical values of reason, passion, intuition and fortune then subtract health. Locate the word that corresponds to that value and use it as the password to enter the barn.

heart
(Solve the buried hand puzzle to unlock)

Silo Unlock

There are four shapes featured on the spirit board. Group the letters by the shape that surrounds them. Note: some letters are surrounded by multiple shapes, meaning that that letter is used multiple times (once for each shape)

Consult the brochure for information about the spirit board’s use in the S.T.A.L.K. investigation. Use the order of the shapes listed.

Unscramble each word. This will give you 4 words that will help you unlock one of the locations using a constellation name.

ursa
(Solve the Spirit board to unlock)

Orchard Unlock

Solve the note nailed to the door to unlock. Focus on the parts of the riddle that focus on the swan and the heavens. Examine the constellation chart

Is there a constellation that is named after a swan. Consult the S.T.A.L.K. website mentioned on the brochure and visit The Body Farm section. Examine the constellation pictures and find the constellation that is near the swan’s head.

The swan constellation is called Cygnus. Use the name of that to unlock location 4 from the map.

lyra
(Solve the note nailed to the door to unlock)

Smokehouse Unlock

Solve the blueprint puzzle to unlock. The S.T.A.L.K. team has a specific method that they use for rating the most haunted room in any house. Consult their notes to find that scale. Add up the values for each room based on the S.T.A.L.K. scale. Determine the most haunted house in the room.

Example: The kitchen is a 5, since E.V.P. is worth 2 and objects moving on their own is worth 3. Take the number of that room and use it to consult the Witch’s Sigil. Take the letter inside each triangle whose number corresponds to the number of the most haunted room in the Montgomery house and use that to unlock a specific place on the farm.

The word you get will once again be a constellation name. The S.T.A.L.K. team hints at which place in their notes about the Witch’s Sigil. Use the word you get to access the smokehouse.

draco
(Solve the blueprint puzzle to unlock)

Corn Fields

In her journal entry, Alice mentions how to access the storm cellar in the corn fields. Use the information you obtain from the corn drawing and from the information you’ve gained thus far from accessing each of the other sites on the farm to unlock.

The letters drawn on the foreheads of each victim is useful in determining the correct constellation.

Use the first and last initials from the name you get from the corn field picture, followed by the name of the constellation you get from the letters on the 4 victims’ heads.

tclynx

Note on STALK website

The hint for this puzzle is found in the S.T.A.L.K. website notes. The part to take note of is: “I'm fairly certain the answer is right in front of my eyes. I just keep skipping over it. Maybe I should start over.”

Starting with the letter ‘D’ move right, skipping every other letter. When you reach the end of the line, go back to the beginning of the line (this time focusing on the second letter in each pairing)

You should get a message that starts with “Dig…”

Dig deep to find the truth. Not all are dead.

Box Solution

The name of the original killer is found by unlocking the storm cellar hidden in the corn field.

2. The buried nickname for the original killer is also found here.

parkerthief

How do I gain access to the dressing room?

Consult Rico’s interview and pay attention to the bands he mentions.

Use the playlist to find numbers associated with each band

Enter the numbers in the order the bands are listed to gain access

81045

How do I open the locked road case?

Read Rich’s interview and take note of what he says about the lock on the road case being changed

Consult the tour poster and find cities that match up to the message he was left.

Use the dates from those cities as your password to open the road case.

515

How do I get on board the tour bus?

Buzz provides instructions about how to access the bus.

Use the photo of The Loa to obtain which symbols goes with which member.

Enter the symbols in the correct order to investigate the bus.

!^@*#

How do I decode the coaster from The Carbon Underground?

Buzz mentions a habit Reg has for writing letters as numbers and numbers as letters

Convert numbers to letters using the numeric position of the letter in the alphabet (1=A, 2=B, etc).

Convert letters by the reverse method (A=1, B=2, etc). Use on the hotel key card

jmroom324

How to unlock the hotel keycard?

Solve the Carbon Underground coaster to gain access. Buzz mentions a habit Reg has for writing letters as numbers and numbers as letters.

Solve the Carbon Underground coaster to gain access. Buzz mentions a habit Reg has for writing letters as numbers and numbers as letters.

Use on the hotel key card.

324

What do I do with the guitar pick?

At the bottom of Benjamin’s notes, he includes a series of music notes with letter names.

Match those music notes to the ones on the pick and see what they spell.

Read through the suspect interviews to figure out who would have this nickname?

decaf

How do I solve the voodoo doll puzzle?

In his interview, Riley tells you that Buzz has a specific way of writing messages that he considers to be sensitive.

Find every instance where letters occur between two X’s

Record each letter and read collectively.

one of the loa is in love with mary

What do I do with the VIP laminate?

In his notes, Benjamin mentions that Mary sometimes puts messages in her set list that only her VIPs have access to. There are 20 numbers on the VIP laminate and 20 songs in the set list.

Match up each number to its corresponding song, count over that number of letters and record the letter you land on.

Example, the first number is 5 and the first song title is “The Wild Life” and the 5th letter in the title is “i

i fired everyone, not reg

Jigsaw Heart Song Puzzle

Mary mentions needing to tell you a secret that only she knows.

She provides a series of coordinates to help reveal this secret.

The lyrics are divided with half on the left side and half on the right side of the page. Use the coordinates to determine the left or right side, line, and then word

i am sick, i have cancer

Fingerprint Puzzle

In his notes, Benjamin talks about something that happened to one of the band member’s fingers. Figure out which fingerprint corresponds to that person and use it to establish where that person was sitting at the bar. This is your starting point.

Read Benjamin’s mention of seat orientation and place all of the band members accordingly at the bar.

Match up which fingerprint corresponds to the one found in the rental card and identify the driver.

Buzz is fingerprint 6 and the driver of the rental car

Laptop

In his notes, Benjamin talks about Mary writing a new song and composing via computer. He provides information that he found by Mary’s guitar.

He also says, “All of the finer points of this have to connect somehow.” Notice that the guitar neck is divided by red lines into sections containing 3 frets.

Plot each of the points on the guitar neck then connect the dots to obtain letters which will spell out Mary’s final song

freed

Bar Puzzle

The bartender talks about someone moving all of his bottles around while he was unloading a truck. The bar shelving is sectioned into 9 squares (3x3)

Paul gives you a strange list that he found in his pocket. Find the designated color of the bottle top for each section and write down the corresponding letter.

Write all letters in a row and read from left to right. Whose initials are in the drunken message?

pc wuz heer

Final Solution

rileyfreed

Locker Contents

Strange black and white message: Tilt the card until you can read the message.

Read the short side first, then the long side.

You should see 3 words on the short side and 3 on the long side. Business card: Visit the website listed on the card and learn an interesting fact about our dead nurse.

car unlock equals badge id numbers. Password is 0227348

Website

Enter Operation: One of the interviews in the box mentions the name of a specific covert operation. Find the name of the operation and then use that to unlock that portion of the site. Look at Richard Queensarce's interview for the operation name.

Update (image of the FBI seal): Read what you unlocked in the “Enter Operation” section carefully for a clue on how to unlock this section. The ID badge may help. Scan the ID. It is not locked. The name you need will be on the time card.

Protocols: You will need information gained from the tilt message found in the locker and the information you find when unlocking the nurse’s car. Read the note found in the glovebox carefully. You may have seen some of those words in the list of protocols located in the FBI Update. Use the order they appear in the note to gain the numeric sequence to unlock.

Enter Operation: password is hacksaw
Found in Richard Queensacre’s interview

Update: password is barbara
Found on the time card you get from scanning the ID badge

Protocols: password is 73146
Obtained from looking at the note found in the glove box of the locked car and the Protocols list at the end of the Update document

Matching Suspects with Game Characters

This is a multi-step process that will force you to examine information found in numerous documents. Here are the places to focus on for information on matching each suspect with the Wastelands of Warael character that corresponds to them (in no particular order).
- The King in Yellow Puzzle/Refrigerator Magnet Message on Case Brief Session notes from Frederic Le Grange/Eye Chart
- Rorschach evaluation (one patient’s Rorschach evaluation matches closely with one of the character cards)
- Additional Patient Notes (one patient’s interests match up particularly well with one of the character cards as described by The Countess)
- Overall Rating Card from Wastelands of Warael game (calculating the overall rating for each character will help you match one suspect up to the corresponding character and will also help eliminate one suspect)
- Suspect interviews
- Queensacre Interview
- Map/Dry Erase Board

Rosedriah=dead nurse (read the Countess’ interview)
Jiron=Markus Kyle (Additional Patient Notes and info the Countess gives )
Azzomar=Carlton Blaise (Richard Queensacre interview and rating value)
Ifera=Frederic Le Grange (Map/Dry Erase Board )
Kurkellan=Ronald Emerson (The King in Yellow Puzzle/Refrigerator Magnet Message on Case Brief and info on Ronald Emerson )
Brakor=Mitchell Yardmore (in the suspect info page we are told Mitchell Yardmore fixated on the number 80 and Brokors overall rating is 80)
Samazel=Abigail Crowley (Rorschach evaluation )
Lyscil, Tharok, Neyrper-not used (see eye chart puzzle)

The King in Yellow

Write the letters down in numeric order (use the numbers beneath each).

You will end up with a word that is significant.

This will help you match a suspect to a character card.

carcosa

Strange Black and White Letter (gray background)

Find a mirror and hold the backwards message up to it. Read an important fact about one of the characters.

Session Notes with Le Grange

Use this in conjunction with the Eye Chart.

Use the word in bold at the end of each line to correspond to a specific line on the eye chart.

Move up or down on the eye chart according to the numeric order to get the correct sequence of letters. The message you get will let you discount 3 of the character cards.

Map

Notice the orientation of countries.

Match them up with the names on the dry erase board.

Use information from one of the interviews to match a specific suspect up with a specific character.

Eliminating Suspects

Ronald Emerson: In Mitchell Yardmore’s drawing he says “When darkness meets a golem, so mysterious and solemn...Under blood red skies, they remain closest allies.” Rosedriah’s magic ability is the Call of Darkness and Kurkellan (Emerson) is a frost price whose magic ability is Ice Golems. Darkness and Ice are allies which indicates that the people those characters represent (nurse and Emerson) are friends.”

Carlton Blaise: In the interview with Richard Queensacre, he tells you that the person with an overall rating of 73 is allies with the Witch Queen and assures you that person would never kill her. Azzomar is the character whose overall rating is 73. We link Blaise to Azzomar because of of the nickname The Valley Falls Observer gave him after his killing spree: The All-Seeing Eye (which, incidentally, is the skill ability for Azzomar).

Frederic Le Grange: From his interview-“Frederic frequently communicates his thoughts by writing them down in strange ways, however, it is unclear whether the bizarre methods he uses to communicate mirror whatever he is feeling at the moment.” Mirror is the key word here and links to the backwards message. The mirrored message reads: “My character hails from a land of extreme cold. I've done a bunch of horrible things, things I regret, things that landed me here. But I only did bad things to people who deserved it. I would never kill someone who was trying to do good.” Because we’ve linked Frederic to Ifera with the Map/Dry Erase board and deduce that he wrote the backwards message which references a character coming from a land of extreme cold, we read his testimony about never killing someone who was trying to do good and eliminate him as a suspect.

Mitchell Yardmore: In the Update section on the Valley Falls Lawn Care website it says: “There is a character in the game called Brakor who only kills men. Women and children are off limits because of a moral code that was developed at some point in the character’s backstory.” We are able to link Yardmore to Brakor by the statement in his interview notes that says, “Another strange thing about him is his affinity for the number 80.” 80 is Brakor’s overall value.

Abigail Crowley: Protocol unlock on the Valley Falls Lawn Care website says that Hacksaw isn’t a woman.

Markus Kyle: is the killer

Final Solution

kylejiron

Wrecked Car Card Unlock

Watch the Breaking News video to determine the last place one of the infected was sighted.

Read the email that mentions where Benjamin was going.

Read the 911 transcript and follow the path that Benjamin takes on the map. Use the name of the place where he ends up to unlock the QR code. Use the unlocked information in conjunction with something Benjamin says on the 911 report to place one of the missing persons in the correct cell.

collinshardware

(Use the Breaking News report and Benjamin's email in the Beginning Brief to get his starting location. Then use the 911 transcript to find the end location)

Wall Code/Red Letters

A hint on how to translate these letters can be found on one of the chemical jugs.

A=?

Once you’ve determined what A equals using the decoder on the chemical jugs, use that information to correctly translate each letter on the wall. Example: A=Z, B=Y, and C=X so, it is the alphabet backwards.The decoded message from the wall will be used in conjunction with the photograph of the hash marks. The answer to the question posed will unlock the safe card.

Wall Translation: How many days have I been here times two

Hash Marks: 433

Safe Unlock: 866

(Use the photo of the chemical jugs to help translate the wall of red letters, then count the hash marks and do the math to unlock the safe).

Unlocking the safe

Solve the Wall Code/Red Letters to unlock.

866

(use the photo of the chemical jugs to help translate the wall of red letters, then count the hash marks and do the math to unlock the safe)

Failsafe unlock

First you need to have the safe unlocked.

Then you will need to solve the Chemical Compounds Puzzle to unlock.

rita

Alternating Rows of Numbers and Letters

Read the note on the back of the Periodic Table that mentions where this was found.

The note left behind in that cell says, “No One Can Save Us.”

Use the letter beneath every number that isn’t a 1 since the note says “No One.” Use the information gained from the puzzle solution to help put one of the missing persons in the correct cell.

A teacher is in cell b

(Benjamin’s note tie the “No one” hint to this puzzle)

VFPD Missing Persons Card

Use the correct reference number to unlock the email.

Only one of the missing persons has a reference number.

Use the information gained from the email to place one of the missing persons in the correct cell.

86342

Chemical Compounds Puzzle

On Clayton Wilbanks’ notes, he lists several groupings of elements and describes them as a failsafe.

Use the periodic table to determine the abbreviation for each element mentioned and use those abbreviations to create words.

Once you have done this for all 4 lines, use the directions obtained in conjunction with the syringes found in the opened safe. Based on the unit of measure and substance given, find the correct letter that represents each line of elements. Use the 4 letter password to unlock the computer monitor.

One half ounce gepxe
One ounce dycta
One half ounce alc
One ounce arnp

The letters you should obtain from the syringes are: RITA

This is the name of the failsafe and the password to Wilbanks’ computer.

(Use the list of elements Clayton’s gives with the periodic table to get the first part, then use the solution with what you get from the safe to complete the second part)

Letters and Numbers (3 rows marked out)

Once you’ve unlocked Clayton’s computer, he gives you vital information about “the game” that the missing women play in their cells.

The first three winning items are represented by the lines that have been marked out (these have already been played).

In his last mention of the game, Wilbanks says that the winner will be the one he injects. Thus, the fourth winning item represents Patient Zero. In his description of the rules, Wilbanks says that the winner is the person who ends up with the winning item based on the directions he provides. Using the information on the computer screen, assign the correct items to each cell. You should have each missing person in the correct cell at this point. Follow Clayton’s directions, using CW as clockwise and CCW as counter clockwise, moving the items around the cells in a circular pattern. Keep in mind the one rule Clayton put into place and wrote on the back of his wedding photo: “Only cells that have life matter.” This means skipping cells that are empty or contain someone who is dead. Determine which cell ends up with the ticket (winning item #4). This is Patient Zero.

The person who ends up with the ticket: Lynn Price

How to place each victim in the correct cell.

To place Michelle Camp, read Benjamin’s notes and listen to the audio file you get when you unlock the email from the Valley Falls Police Department Missing Persons Hotline.

To place Brandy Clingan, read through the notes from Clayton Wilbanks. His darling loves something and Brandy has a tattoo of that something.

To place Pam Cladwell, solve the puzzle with 4 rows of alternating numbers and letters. You will need to have Brandy in her correct cell before you can place Pam in her correct cell. To place Sally Stallings, read through the 911 transcript and unlock the car wreck. To place Amanda Gurley, read Clayton’s notes about who he tried the treatment on and notice when everyone was reported missing. Take note of what happened to the victim after the first treatment. Then read Benjamin’s notes. He mentions what cell the dead body is in. To place Stacy Forbus, read both Clayton Wilbanks’ notes and Benjamin’s notes. Clayton mentions something about the realtor and Benjamin mentions finding something in the cell at the end of the hallway. To place Lynn Price, you will need to have all of the other women placed in their correct cells. Read through Benjamin’s notes. One of the cells he mentions seeing some writing in should not have a person placed in there yet. This is where Lynn goes. Cells C, E, and G are empty.

Cell A: Michelle Camp (She has a son named Bryce, and the name Bryce is scratched on the wall in cell A).

Cell B: Pam Caldwell (When you solve the puzzle that has 4 rows of alternating numbers and letters, you are told that a teacher is in cell B).

Cell D: Lynn Price (Benjamin finds writing in cell D. So you know one of the women was in this cell. Once you have placed all of the others this leaves only Lynn to place in cell D.)

Cell F: Brandy Clingan (Clayton mentions placing a butterfly in cell F. This is a reference to Brandy’s butterfly tattoo).

Cell H: Sally Stallings (When you unlock the car wreck, you see the tag for cell H, and Benjamin mentions the person is wearing ballet slippers. This ties the person to the dance instructor who is Sally.)

Cell I: Stacy Forbus (Clayton mentions that the realtor is complaining about the smell from the dead body next to her, and Benjamin mention finding a dead body in cell J).

Cell J: Amanda Gurley (Clayton mentions trying the treatment on the first person he kidnapped. When you look at all of their reported missing dates, you figure out that it is Amanda. Clayton also mentions that they died. Using this, with where Benjamin mentions finding the dead body, you can place Amanda in cell J) .

Detective Notes

Solution card

CBlack Rock Butcher Note #1 (once upon a time):

Extract all extra letters from the note.

Use the resulting message to tell you how to decode what’s at the bottom of the note.

Take the hidden message’s advice and skip the appropriate number of characters for each encoded character at the bottom. Use with the bee tag.

Message gained by extracting extra letters: all it takes is one right decision.

Decoded message: Not bees one two or three, scratch eight seven and thirteen, add what’s left and that suspect set free.

The Toymaker Puzzle (yellow tag with bee):

Use the directions obtained from Butcher note #1 and apply that.

The directions from the Butcher puzzle tell you which of the hexagonal sections to focus on.

Obtain the correct number. Refer to the map and use that number to eliminate a suspect.

Answer: 9
Use with map.
This eliminates Wallace Hammett as a suspect since location 9 is the police station and he works there.
(use the solution from the Black Rock Butcher Note #1 (once upon a time) with the Bee tag to solve)

Butcher Note #2 (Sometimes you fall in love...):

Extract all extra letters from the note that shouldn’t be there.

You will obtain 4 words from this. The symbol at the bottom of the note tells you that this is a “play on words.”

Take the 4 words you’ve obtained and find a different way of saying them. They will reveal an alias for one of the subjects. Read the usernames from the Den of Thieves. Which one matches the play on word phrase you got? Who would have the shortened name of Millie? Read the notes on the back of the Carbon underground poster. Pay close attention to the times of death of the victims.

Would Equine Equals Millie

Play on Words Version: Wood Horse Is Millie (refers to woodenhorse83) This eliminates Amelia (Millie) as a suspect since she was hacking the Valley Falls PD during the time of one of the murders.

Toymaker puzzle #2 (green tag, multiple fonts):

Take a look at the message the copycat left behind on the wall of The Hideaway Motel.

Focus on the three colors the note mentions. Go through the Toymaker tag and pull out all of the letters with those colors. Once you are finished you will have information about two different suspects.

You should have a word that goes with a suspect, their gender, and which is their dominant hand. The dominant hand information will help you eliminate a suspect. Look again at the witness interviews. One of them has information about which hand the murderer uses. You should be able to eliminate a suspect now.

GLASSESDNAXXRH, TATTOODNAXXLH

XX refers to DNA makeup/female sex chromosomes. Gives information about two female subjects.

This tells you that Amelia is right-handed and Raven Blake is left-handed. We know from Clinton Pierce’s interview (given on Jasmine Sands’ page) that the killer is right-handed. While this does not prove that Amelia is the killer since there are several right-handed people among the suspects, it does help us eliminate Raven

The Seaside Strangler Notes

Read the note carefully and pay special attention to words that may give directions

The words to focus on: scramble, multiple groups, three sides, four sides, encircled. Examine the other Strangler note and focus on shapes with three sides, four sides, and circles. Group each of them together and unscramble the letters by shape.

Take all the letters from the triangles to get a name then use the letters from the squares and circles to find out where that person was. If you check the time of the event you will be able to eliminate a suspect.

Harris Attended Unmasked

This lets you eliminate Justin Harris as a suspect since this event coincides with one of the murders.

Chimera Note (Detective Notes)

This note combines elements of The Toymaker, Seaside Strangler, and Black Rock Butcher notes.

Pull out all extra letters from the note. You should obtain a phrase from this.

Examine the letters at the bottom of the note carefully. You should be able to find all of the words you’ve obtained in the two sequences of letters. Cross each word out as you find it and write down what is left. You should have a single word that remains. This will tie in more once you have finished all of the other puzzles.

private

Investigation Board

The board contains images from every case The Will Street Detective Agency has worked in the past year.

Notice that some of the push pins on the board are numbered. Use the glossary of terms on the Will Street Detective Agency sheet to determine what each numbered image is a representation of.

Once you’ve determined which description goes with which image use the letter that corresponds to the description. Follow the numbers, writing down the letter that corresponds to each photo until you’ve reached the end. You should have a statement from the copycat that gives you an important fact.

I am not an observer.

This lets you eliminate Dexter Greeley since he works at the Valley Falls Observer.

Final Solution

This requires the last name of the Copycat and information gained from the Detective Notes puzzle (location 11-City Hall) .

mitchellprivate

Butcher Notes

Determine every letter that shouldn’t be in the note and reveal The Butcher’s secret message.

Each note contains a secret message from The Butcher that should be used in conjunction with the puzzle beneath.

Accessing The Edge of Darkness Podcast Files

Determine where each victim was found.

Use the map of Black Rock with the newspaper articles to figure the two names you need to gain access to the exclusive content.

sadielambert

Who is the Original Owner of the Mad Dog Saloon?

Read through the Sheriff’s journal. The name you need it in there.

redbuchanon

Message Left by Red Buchanon

Red gave the Sheriff a wooden disc with two circles of letters.

Use the rubbing the sheriff took off the disk (found on the page with Red’s interview) to translate the message.

You are going from the inner ring of letters to the outer ring of letters. The message will start with “The…”

“The Reverend was in a relationship with Pearlie”

What Secrets Have You Uncovered?

You will need to have solved the message left by Red Buchanon and the fifth Butcher note to unlock this.

Be sure you use the spelling of the name given in the fifth Butcher note.

gatespearl

Butcher Puzzle #1

Use the image of the straight razor found by the podcasters to help determine how the value of each symbol is determined.

Count the number of intersections in each of the symbols on Note #1. Use this with the message you pulled from the text of the note.Read Peter James's interview.

Opening night was the night of the first murder. The drunk man was one of the suspects and was locked in the closet from around 9 until midnight. You should be able to eliminate a suspect with this information.

Message within text = “time of death”
Puzzle = 1045

(Use the time of death, the information provided by Peter Jameson, and the times and dates on “The Famous Palomino Players” poster to eliminate Garrett Wolf since we know he is an alcoholic based on his bio.)

Butcher Note #2

You will see three sections at the bottom of the note.

Each section has groupings of letters in multiple shapes that will fit into the grid below. Arrange each group of letters so that they fit into the grid below.

Take all of the letters in the spaces marked with an X and use them to spell a needed word. Determine all three words and use it in connection with the message pulled from the above note. You can eliminate a suspect with this information.

Message within text: “I arrived one of these months”
Puzzle solution: june july november
(This eliminates Emmett Baker if you read his bio.)

Butcher Note #3

This note mentions certain measurements.

Each hand contains 5 fingers.

Determine the proper measurement for a hand based on the information given. Use that to determine the heights of each horse. A hand is four inches. Read Jonas Cartwright’s interview and pay attention to the part about his son, Silas. Use the magnifier to examine the Wanted poster and determine how to use the information you’ve obtained about ‘hands high’ to eliminate a suspect.

Message contained in note: “give yourself a hand”
Convert 5 fingers to 1 hand = 4 inches
Dreamer = 18 hands high or 72 inches (6 feet tall)
(This eliminates Rev. Earl Gates if you read his bio)

Butcher Letter #4

Uncover the hidden message just as you’ve done in the other notes.

The message provides the directions for what to do with the puzzle involving lengths of rope. Ten can refer to leaving the word ‘ten’ and not the number of ropes.

Read the message left behind once you’ve done what the message instructs. The message is backwards. You can eliminate a suspect with this information.

Message contained in note: “remove six ropes to make ten”
Message revealed by rope puzzle: I use both hands both don’t have a gun (This eliminates the gunslinger.)

Butcher ’ s Note #5

Uncover the hidden message just as you’ve done in the other notes.

The message you get from the extra letters is a clue on how to read the row of letters at the bottom of the note.

Pull a letter from the left side then the right, repeat this pattern as you work your way to the center. The message will start with “I did…”

Message contained in note: “From left and right to center”
Message encoded by Red: “I did it all for pearl”
(This is a subtle hint about the relationship between Ms. Pearlie and Rev. Earl Gates.)

Drink Recipe Puzzle

1. Once you’ve determined who The Black Rock Butcher is, find the drink that uses all the ingredients that correspond to the killer.

sidewinder

Final Solution

You will need to eliminate all suspects, solve the drink puzzle, and gain access to “What Secrets Have You Uncovered?” to complete this mystery.

sidewinderbrucelust

Will Street Notes
Ready to Solve the Case?

Birds of a Feather Unlock

Examine the document with the names of various birds.

Find the birds that “flock together.” (Same names)

Trace everywhere the name of a specific bird appears to obtain a number. Find all 6 numbers. Example: If you trace the path everywhere the word “quail” appears, you get a 2.

238406

Radio Puzzle

Scan the QR code on the radio and listen to what plays.

Examine the card with a morse code decoder on the back.

Listen to each sound from the radio, and translate what you hear. Short sounds are dots. Longer sounds are dashes.

street

Key/Door/Telegraph Card Unlock

1. This requires three components to open. The first component uses the motel key graphic, the Lady Justice card, and the last entry in the journal.
2. Determine the six numbers to use from the Lady Justice card, and use the riddle from the end of the journal to obtain a specific number.
3. Start at the appropriate place on the motel board full of keys (using the directions provided in the last journal entry) and move accordingly based on the specific number you found.

1. You should see an image at the bottom of the card that says “An Imperial Suite…” It matches an image found on another document.
2. You will notice that the third door is marked with an asterisk.
3. In The Masque of The Red Death story, there is a line that mentions “an imperial suite.” This is the section of the tale where each room is given a specific color. Find the color of the third room (third door).

1. Use the answer you obtained from the morse code puzzle.
2. Putting them all together: Find the card that features a column of numbers, a column of colors, and a column of words that all describe different types of roads.
3. Take the number you found from the key step, and translate it using the card. Do the same thing for the color and for the morse code solution. You will end up with a 4-digit number that can be used to unlock the QR code.

Key -You end up at key number 2.
Door -Green
Code - 9011

X Marks the Spot/Letter Grid

Notice that both of these cards have similar looking backgrounds to link them.

With X marks the spot as a starting point, find the X on the letter grid.

Use the colored numbers from the math puzzle, and move in the direction of the color as it appears on the letter grid. Make sure to start at X. You will make a total of five moves that will give you five letters. Use the word you uncover to unlock the QR code with the metal balls.

freud

Metal Balls Unlock

Solve the X Marks the Spot/Letter Grid puzzle to unlock.

freud

Business Card

Determine the next time in the sequence.

See how much time elapses between the times listed.

Once you have determined each gap of time, determine the pattern and use it to find the final time. Some people find it easier to look at this puzzle as two patterns, one affecting the hours and the other affecting the minutes.

8:19

Book Unlock

To unlock this you will need the graphic featuring all the train times, the missing time from Larry Simmons’ business card, and the information you obtained by unlocking the metal ball QR code.

The information you obtained from the metal ball QR code says “Total time in minutes of departure times for all N. White Plains trains.”

Example: If the time was 2:32 you would convert the 2 hours into 120 minutes then add the 32 to that to get 152 minutes. The times on the back of the business card correspond to the train times. Since you are looking for only the N. White Plains train times you would take the 1st, 3rd, and 5th train times from the card. Convert those times to minutes and add them up. The total will unlock the book file.

1177

Chess Unlock

By now, you should have unlocked three files (Birds of a Feather, Book Graphic, and Key/Door/Radio Transmission). Two of them feature half of a grid where chess pieces are positioned. The third shows a grid of letters.

Determine where all the chess pieces are located on the grid and use the letters found in those spots to spell a word.

guilty

Final Solution

terminationdade

The Seaside Strangler
